name: HOW-TO: Use Email Shortcodes
title: HOW-TO: Use Email Shortcodes
body:
WHY USE SHORTCODES WHEN SENDING EMAILS IN YOULI?

  • Send mass emails that are personalized to each traveler 
  • Spend less time writing emails and more time planning your trips

HOW TO USE SHORTCODES

  • Using shortcodes will allow you to send one email without worrying about filling in each traveler's individual information. So all you have to do is input the shortcode into your email, and YouLi will do the rest!

    For example, [InviteeFullName] will be replaced by the traveler's full name. Which means. Each traveler will receive a personalized email.
  • Ensure that there are no typos for important information such as pricing and due dates.
  • Make sure you have brackets [ ] on each side of the code

AVAILABLE SHORTCODES

This is the complete list of email message shortcodes.

IMPORTANT NOTE: SHORTCODES ARE CASE-SENSITIVE!

----

  • [AmountDueWithCurrency] - inputs the amount the traveler receiving the email still owes in its place 
  • [TotalTripPrePayWithCurrency] - inputs the total cost of the trip. Whether the traveler has paid part of it or not, this will always stay the same unless the trip planner changes the cost.
  • [TripName] - inputs the name of the trip in its place
  • [InviteeFullName] - inputs the traveler's full name in its place 

HOW TO USE 

  1. Click to MANAGE PEOPLE
  2. Select the travelers you would like to send the message to, by clicking the checkbox next to their name 
  3. Click SEND MESSAGE
  4. Fill in the message using the shortcodes
  5. Select SEND NOW 
  6. Here is what your traveler will see!

name: Active Trip
title: Active Trip
body:
Definition of an Active Trip

An Active trip is one that:

  • Is NOT Archived
  • Has a start date in the future
    • This means it must have a start date set - it cannot have estimated dates

This definition is used for things like:

  • What trips are shown in the Zapier dropdown for certain API integrations
  • Applying coupon codes

name: HOW-TO: Archive a Trip
title: HOW-TO: Archive a Trip
body:
When you're done with a trip, it's easy to archive it.

HOW TO ARCHIVE A TRIP

  1. From your trip dashboard, view the "Trips I'm Planning" tab.
  2. Click into your ACTIVE trips

 

3. Then click the cog (round icon) to expand the menu

4. Then choose ARCHIVE

HOW TO RESTORE AN ARCHIVED TRIP

1. Click into your ARCHIVED trips, from "Trips I'm Planning" (again, within your trip dashboard)

2. Then find the trip you want to restore and click the cog icon

3. Select "Restore" -- ta-da! Your newly restored trip will now live under the ACTIVE tab.

name: HOW-TO: Set Account Time Zone
title: HOW-TO: Set Account Time Zone
body:
Your account time zone displays dates and times across your Youli account. Unlike trip time zones or itinerary-specific time zones that are set to the destination of your trip's time zone, your account time zone should be set to where you currently are. This way, when you set automated reminders or have bookings come in, you will see them appear in the same time zone you are currently in.

OTHER INFORMATION

  • Remember that this is at the account level, so if you change this, the change is only reflected for YOU (this means other team members or Co-Planners will not share the same time zone as you if theirs is set otherwise).
  • If you are traveling, try changing this to fit the time zone you are in. This way times always appear in the time zone that matches your current location!
  • Make sure you don't confuse this with your trip-related time zone. This is just for you, as the trip planner NOT for your travelers. 

SET YOUR ACCOUNT TIME ZONE

1. Go to ACCOUNT > PROFILE

2. Scroll to the TIME ZONE dropdown

3. Open the dropdown and select the time zone that matches your location

4. Click SAVE when you're done

name: HOW-TO: Clear a Task Response
title: HOW-TO: Clear a Task Response
body:
Why clear a task response? 

  1. As the Planner, you cannot edit the Task because a declined person has already responded
  2. As the Planner, you want to edit the Task, but you cannot until all responses have been cleared
  3. The Traveler entered the wrong information and needs to be prompted to complete it again

HOW-TO Clear a Task Response

  • To clear a traveler's task response once it is completed, you will need to be viewing the trip as them

  • After you are in the traveler's view, go to their TASKS

3. Click to SHOW COMPLETED tasks and clear the response for the task in question

  • Set your view to SHOW completed tasks

  • Select the checked box for the task you wish to clear

  • Select CLEAR RESPONSE 

 

Troubleshooting

-> Delete DECLINED travelers 

Sometimes travelers will decline after they have responded to a task. When this happens, we hide their responses from your view; however, when you are managing your tasks, you will still see their response reflected in the numbers under RESPONSES.

If you want these numbers to accurately reflect responses from REGISTERED travelers only, you will need to delete the DECLINED traveler. 

To do this:

  • Under MANAGE PEOPLE, hover over the traveler you wish to delete and select DELETE

  • This action CANNOT be undone 

NOTE: Deleting this invitee removes all of their profile information, optional itinerary responses, task responses, and documents. It cannot be undone.

NOTE: If the person is no longer attending but you need to keep their information, cancel this pop-up and consider leaving their status DECLINED instead.

  • The DECLINED travelers task responses have been deleted

-> Task must be visible to the person

If you do not see the task when clicking to VIEW AS and SHOW COMPLETED, it means the Task is not visible to that person.

Often this is the Task is in the TRASH.

  • Click the FILTER to change to TRASH

  • Click RESTORE to make the task visible again so you can then clear the response 
  • After clearing the response and deleting the person, you can put the Task back in the trash

Otherwise check the visibility of the task itself

  • Click to EDIT the task and scroll to the ASSIGNED section
  • Be sure that either "Everyone Registered" is selected or the person qualifies based on the selected restrictions

name: Using YouLi for group Quotes: Number of Travelers in a Package
title: Using YouLi for group Quotes: Number of Travelers in a Package
body:
Quotes with Number of Travelers

If you are using the CreateTrip API to integrate with your CRM, then you can set the numberTravelers parameter.

When this is set on the initial call or on the update, the package on the trip created/updated will change to show a "Number of Travelers".

This can be changed to update the quote on the Trip Page.

Click to edit Pricing, then click to Edit the package as shown:

The popup should contain a NUMBER OF TRAVELERS field:

If that does not appear, then the trip was not created using the CreateTrip API. To activate this feature, it must be created using the API with a value for the numberTravelers parameter.

How the Pricing looks on Trip Page Quote / Invoice

The price shown at the top of the Trip Page Quote is the price per person rather than the total based on the number of travelers.

The total is calculated on the Invoice using the price per person x the number of travelers set for the selected package.

 

Trip Page Quote Example:

 

Invoice Example:

 

What payment options can I provide?

In addition to Credit Card you can provide alternative payment options and create completely custom instructions like:

  • Bank Transfer
  • Purchase Order
  • Wire Transfer
  • EFT
  • Venmo
  • Bitcoin

Example of Setting up Purchase Order instructions

--> Learn more about direct payments 

Can the person receiving the quote change the number of travelers?

No, the number can only be set by the Planner under the Pricing of the Trip.

This is on purpose since the total cost of the trip can vary significantly based on the number of travelers.

If the person approving the quote needs to change the number, they can contact the Planner and request the change to be made. Remember that the magic link they used to view the Trip Page Quote does not change. So if they are viewing the quote when the change is made, they will be prompted to refresh to see the changes.

Provide different pricing based on number of travelers

Create multiple packages with different prices per person in order to show different options for different numbers of travelers.

Simply copy the first package created from the CreateTrip API and then edit the price per person and the number of travelers.

Then the quote approver can see the two choices and compare. 

Use the description under Advanced option in the package Edit popup to explain the range of travelers that qualifies for that price per person.

name: New Features - Affiliates are available for all Planners - Release 1.118 - Sep 22, 2021
title: New Features - Affiliates are available for all Planners - Release 1.118 - Sep 22, 2021
body:
Our co-founder, Jen Fein, is (safely) on the road in the US, follow her adventures here.

YouLi Delivers new functionality every month based on user feedback.

 

👉🚀👈🏾 Grow your Affiliate network TODAY

Any Planner who can take bookings with YouLi will now have access to invite Affiliates.

Are you inviting Affiliates to sell your trips - Learn More

Are you an Affiliate looking to learn more about selling trips on YouLi - Learn More

--> Want to join the next live masterclass on Affiliates? Register now <--

 

👉🚀👈🏾 YouLi is growing with you, check out our new plans

Travel is restarting, so we know that it's an exciting but uncertain time. That's why we've introduced the EXPLORER plan, with $0 monthly fee and 4% booking fee.

So you only pay when you take bookings!🤘

 

New accounts will now automatically be on the EXPLORER plan which allows you to take bookings without paying a monthly fee for only a 4% booking fee on top of the credit card fee charged by Stripe or Square.

We've also introduced the PRO plan in two flavors:

  1. PRO BYO WEBSITE
    • Perfect if you've already invested in your own website, but the booking process or inquiry process you have just isn't cutting it. 
    • Keep all your hard work, and streamline the checkout process with YouLi Trip Page integration

  2. PRO PLUG N PLAY
    • Perfect if you're just getting started and the idea of building a website fills you with dread - you just want to plan trips!
    • All the same YouLi Trip Page features as BYO but also comes with a Plug N Play website with your own domain
    • We've seen clients finish their site content in a day so they can start taking bookings right away

If you need advanced ENTERPRISE options (like 0% booking fee), book a call to review your growth needs and we'll be sure to provide pricing options that meet your business needs. 

Grandfathered In

If you have an old plan like CREW, CREW STARTER or VENTURE, you can stay on it as long as you maintain your payments on time.

We call it "being grandfathered in", because it means a lot to us that you've been so committed to us! 

 

👉🚀👈🏾 GUIDES have become EXPLORERS

Planners on the GUIDE plan have been automatically converted to EXPLORERs and take bookings (on Stripe ONLY).

LEARN MORE


🔎🐜🔍 Always improving

  1. The Affiliate embed link was not correct after changing style - FIXED
  2. We noticed that people were missing the option to set their timezone, so we made the default more appropriate - is this because Jen is in America now instead of Australia? - MAYBE

🤜 IMPORTANT: Set your Timezone!

Otherwise all the dates in the system will be on the wrong day! Silly Aussies, don't they know they are in the future?

To Edit: Click your name/avatar, then click ACCOUNT to edit your Profile

name: GUIDEs are now EXPLORERs - supercharged for the post-covid recovery!
title: GUIDEs are now EXPLORERs - supercharged for the post-covid recovery!
body:
Take Bookings with Ease

Congratulations, you've been promoted to EXPLORER, which means you can now take bookings (Stripe ONLY) along with many other enhanced features!

Curious what's different between the old and new plan? 

  

But wait, there's MORE!

  • More Tasks: From 2 to 8!
  • More pricing packages: From 0 to 5!
  • All the booking page features you were missing - and you only pay when you take bookings
    • Groups + Inventory Management
    • Personalized Traveler Portal
    • Affiliates

We Don't Hold Your Money

YouLi is a software platform that connects to your existing Stripe account.

So we don't ever hold your money. Your settlement timeframe is determined by your account with Stripe or Square and can be as soon as 1 day once you establish a good reputation.

Get started with bookings and GET PAID FASTER!

 

Booking Fee Explained

The 4% Booking Fee is applied on credit card charges only and is non-refundable. But you CAN pass this fee onto your travelers as a surcharge (depending on your legal jurisdiction).

If you're looking to provide alternative payment options/methods that have no booking fee, you should upgrade to PRO!

NOTE: This is a YouLi fee, that does NOT include the merchant fee charged by Square or Stripe. Your fee from your chosen payment gateway depends on your volume and country.

name: Upcoming Feature: Add-ons for families
title: Upcoming Feature: Add-ons for families
body:
This is a feature on the YouLi Roadmap for the future.

If you want to see this feature come to life, be sure to submit your 'vote' so that we prioritize it!

SUMMARY: Allow individuals in invitation groups to opt-in and out of add-ons, independently

 

WHY?

  • Allow travelers of the same invitation group to choose different packages and add-ons (activities) without the planner going in and making manual selections or price changes.

  • Give families the ability to curate the trip for each member. 

Click "yes" under "Was this article helpful?" to let us know that you'd like this feature added to YouLi!

name: FUTURE READY Plan - What's Included and When to Grow Out of It
title: FUTURE READY Plan - What's Included and When to Grow Out of It
body:
YouLi Plan: FUTURE READY (monthly or annual)
Status: No longer available for new clients, grandfathered for any active subscribers


Future Ready was designed for companies that want to be sure they are ready to restart but can't afford to commit to a monthly fee at this time. It was released during the worst of the covid lockdowns in 2020. 

Any YouLi customer on this plan whose subscription is not past due will be allowed to remain on this plan until the end of 2022 (or to the end of your paid subscription, whichever is later).

What's Included

On this plan, you can use all the features in the platform that you see, including the mobile app!

Any feature you can't use will be disabled or prompt you to upgrade.

The first trip you run will be 0% booking fee on any credit card payments, but it will be 2% for any trips after that. 

  • 1 Team Owner user
  • YouLi branded Mobile Trip app
  • Unlimited White label Trip Pages on the youli.io domain
  • 8 Tasks/Trip
  • 1 Pricing package/Trip
  • Credit Card payments ONLY (0% for first trip + 2% Booking Fee on all trips after that)

What's NOT Included

Upgrade in YouLi platform to access these features based on current plan availability.

  • Add team members
  • Add more than 1 pricing package per trip
  • Manage Hotel Inventory
  • Accept booking fee-free direct payments 
  • Have more than 8 tasks per trip
  • Publish a Plug N Play website (example: https://melanated.travel)

name: White Label Domain - Custom Domain Masking on youli.io
title: White Label Domain - Custom Domain Masking on youli.io
body:
What is White Label Domain?

This is when YouLi masks https://youli.io with your domain or sub-domain.

For example:

  • trips.runwildretreats.com
  • trips.rareairtravel.com.au

 

Will my youli.io links still work?

Yes!

Both the White Label Domain and the youli.io domain will work and show the same up-to-date content. So if you already published links on social media or sent emails, those links will still work.

It is safe to switch anytime!


Add-On to your Annual Premium Plan

You can request a White Label Domain for an extra fee, if you're on an annual premium plan, just open a help ticket to upgrade and start setting up the domain.

Included as part of all our ENTERPRISE plans, book in a sales call to learn more

 

What setup is required?

If YouLi does not host your DNS, then we'll ask you to add a few DNS records to point the domain to our servers.

If you don't know how to do that, we can do it for you for a support fee.

Will this impact my website SEO?

If you setup your Google Search Console with a "domain property", then the search data for your website and subdomain hosted by YouLi will both appear in your Search Console so you can monitor them together.

Trip Pages are then just like any other page on your website in terms of SEO considerations.

--> Read more tips for YouLi SEO

Can I install my website favicon on my Trip Pages?

YES!

When embedding your trip shop into your website, the links open a new tab in the traveler browser.

Without WLD this will show the YouLi favicon:

WITH WLD this will show YOUR favicon:

--> Set your favicon under Account Site Settings 

What analytics is supported?

We will install any analytics tag you request when setting up your WLD.

For complete control, we recommend installing a Google Tag Manager (GTM) tag - then you can add as many tags as you like.

Otherwise, we can install your GA4 or Facebook pixel.

Changes to these tags after setup incur a service fee.


Is this the same as my website domain?

Usually this is a subdomain of your website domain, whether that is hosted with YouLi or externally.

For SEO reasons, we typically recommend something like:

trips.[yourdomain.com]

but it can be any subdomain or domain you have registered (where you control the DNS)

 

Can I register a domain with YouLi?

No, we do not offer domain registration services. There are many service providers, and we recommend you use one you're familiar with or your tech advisors recommend.

name: Installments - How Trip Page Invoice displays Payment Plan options, overdue, due soon and paid
title: Installments - How Trip Page Invoice displays Payment Plan options, overdue, due soon and paid
body:
How Installments appear to Travelers on Trip Page Invoice

If you have enabled installments as a Planner, your Travelers will see the option to "Choose a Payment Plan" as shown in the example below.

They can always "Pay Remaining Balance" at any time. This is automatically calculated based on the price for the invitation group and the payments and coupons applied.

 

Overdue Installment

If a Traveler has not made a payment on an installment that is OVERDUE, it will show that in the table like the example below.

Notice that the Traveler must pay the next installment, then the one after that as separate transactions, but at least they can see what is owed.

In a future release this will be changed so they can pay the outstanding installments in one transaction.

 

Manual Payments can be made against an Installment

As a Planner, you might receive a payment that you want to "count against the installment" so they are no longer reminded to pay.

In this case you can "Record a Manual Payment" and it will appear on the Invoice like the example below.

As you can see, the amount does not have to match the scheduled Deposit amount if the Planner records a manual payment. 

Once the manual payment is recorded, the Traveler will be prompted to pay the next installment and show the appropriate DUE, DUE SOON or OVERDUE.

name: New Features - Installments DUE NOW on the way to Auto-charge - Release 1.116 - Aug 19, 2021
title: New Features - Installments DUE NOW on the way to Auto-charge - Release 1.116 - Aug 19, 2021
body:
YouLi Delivers new functionality every month based on user feedback.

Sign up to get updates delivered to your inbox.

 

👉💰👈🏾 All Installments show on Invoice with status

Installments are an amazing feature, read about them here.

BEFORE this release installments worked by having a traveler select an installment from a dropdown like this:

PROBLEM: Because of relative due dates, sometimes the deposit would show after an installment with a fixed due date (when the traveler has registered late). And if the traveler doesn't click the box, they don't know they need to pay the deposit and they pay the wrong amount.

SOLUTION: Now we show all the installments in one table, so it is clear which installments are due and allowing the traveler to select to pay the next one or pay the remaining balance.

 

EXAMPLE:

In this example, the traveler has paid their Deposit, and the next installment is "DUE SOON". They will have received an email reminder if automated reminders are turned on.

They have the option to "Pay next installment" or "Pay Remaining Balance". 

The due date for the installments is shown in the table, so the traveler always knows when each installment is due.

 

==> Login to see for yourself or read our help doc for more examples

 

NEXT UPDATE: Currently the traveler can only pay one installment at a time, so if they are late, they have to pay the Installment #1 and the Deposit as two transactions, next update will allow them to pay for both in one transaction (effectively "catch up" to all outstanding installments).

ROADMAP: This enhancement is useful all by itself, but is also on our roadmap to implement Auto-charge - which will allow your travelers to accept automatic charges to their card according to their payment plan.

 

👉💰👈🏾 Display Per Person price for Quotes

For normal trip packages, the Trip Page shows the TOTAL price for all members of the invitation group and including all add-ons. 

For Quotes, the important number that will be compared to competitive bids is the PER PERSON price, so that is what will show when "Number of Travelers" is set on a package.

This is an ENTERPRISE feature, contact us to find out more. 

EXAMPLE:

 

🔎🐜🔍 Always improving

We are always improving as we find little issues, here's a few we fixed:

  • Button in registration confirmation email said "PAY NOW" even if the traveler owed $0 - FIXED - thanks to True North Travel for reporting
  • Expanding and Exporting people after searching on Manage People did not include all Package and Pricing information - FIXED - thanks to Global Family Travels for reporting
  • Automated reminders were not always sending on time - FIXED - thanks to Chris on YouLi dev team for finding

 

Did you miss these features from past releases? It's REALLY important - go do this NOW!

 

👉🏷👈🏾 The 10 Things I Love About My Trip

We have a favor to ask of you...spend a little time today thinking about how you want to categorize your trips. 

Then...ADD YOUR TAGS to each trip! (up to 10)

 

 

🔎🧁🔍 DO IT WITH TAGS: SEO Friendly Trip Summary 

Ready to adopt the new Trip Card style? Great! But first you'll need to update your SHARE SUMMARY. 

Click to "UPDATE TRIP" and then scroll down to edit. 

NOTE: Max length is 150 characters to ensure it fits. So choose your words wisely!

--> Learn More about SHARE SUMMARY feature.

name: HOW-TO: Customize the Trip Cards on YouLi embed
title: HOW-TO: Customize the Trip Cards on YouLi embed
body:
This article assumes you have already installed the embed code and now you want to change how the style appears on your website. This can be as simple as a font change or as complicated as the example below.

If you have not, be sure to start there: Integrate with your website

 

Common Customizations

1. Use Tags to limit which trips are shown - Learn how

2. Limit number of trips shown - Learn how

 

Advanced Customizations

Example code using the default trip card styles:

  <script src="https://trips.globalfamilytravels.com/embeds/script/trips/global-family-travels/?view=card&style=detailed&tags=street%20art"></script>

Notice that the image is duplicated because the trips have the same banner (this is a multiple departure date experience). Also notice there is no share summary set, leaving a large blank space.

So in this case we want to:

  1. Hide the image
  2. Change the gradient to a solid color
  3. Remove the share summary space

Using the customized trip card styles:

In this case, we used this CSS to accomplish this goal. Your CSS may vary depending on the stylesheets on your website. 

Be sure to include this in the HTML section when referencing the YouLi embed code.

NOTE: You usually need media queries. BE SURE TO CHECK your mobile version.

<p>
<script src="https://trips.globalfamilytravels.com/embeds/script/trips/global-family-travels/?view=card&style=detailed&tags=street%20art"></script>
</p>

<style>

.trip-card-details, .trip-card-wrapper.detailed h3 {
font-family: arial;
}

.trip-card-banner-image {
height: 80px;
}
.trip-card-banner-image img {
display: none;
visibility: hidden;
}

.trip-card-details {
height: 160px;
}
.trip-card-details-description {
display: none;
visibility: hidden;
}
.trip-card-details-footer {
position: relative;
top: -70px;
}
.trip-card-wrapper.detailed .trip-card-banner-image .gradient-overlay {
background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom,rgba(54,182,201,1),rgba(54,182,201,1))
}

@media (max-width: 767px) {
.trip-card-banner-image {
height: 100px;
}

.trip-card-wrapper.detailed h3 {
font-family: arial;
/* display: inline-block; */
margin: 10px 8px;
/* font-size: 18px !important; */
}
.trip-card-details-footer {
position: relative;
top: -10px !important;
}
.trip-card-details{
height: auto;
}

}
</style>

 

In this example we also added a link to the "Find My Trip" feature for people looking for an existing booking. That was not done in CSS, it was done in the WYSIWIG web editor.

To see the live example, click here.

Other Ideas

With the right developer, you can even implement filters and searches on the embedded content.

Don't have your own developer? Open a HELP ticket within YouLi to purchase website integration support.

name: HOW-TO: Setup Facebook (FB) Pixel with YouLi Trip Pages
title: HOW-TO: Setup Facebook (FB) Pixel with YouLi Trip Pages
body:
Available only with White Label Domains

If you are eligible, then follow these steps to provide the Pixel to YouLi team for installation on your domain.

 

1. Get Pixel Code to YouLi to Install

  1. Create (or select existing) pixel
  2. Have us install the pixel for you on your Trip Pages.
    • Once done, respond to or open a YouLi help ticket to let us know.
    • There are two ways to get us the pixel code:
      1. Add YouLi as a Partner (355591381549759) to access your Pixel

        • Go to https://business.facebook.com/settings/pixels (for your brand)
        • After you click Assign Partners, you will see this dialog. 
          • Add YouLi's Business ID: 355591381549759
          • Select Manage Pixel
          • Click Next and complete the process
    • Get the code yourself and open a support request with the code.
      • The code looks similar this, but you'll have to get the actual code from within Facebook Business Settings
    • <!-- Facebook Pixel Code -->
      <script>
      !function(f,b,e,v,n,t,s)
      {if(f.fbq)return;n=f.fbq=function(){n.callMethod?
      n.callMethod.apply(n,arguments):n.queue.push(arguments)};
      if(!f._fbq)f._fbq=n;n.push=n;n.loaded=!0;n.version='2.0';
      n.queue=[];t=b.createElement(e);t.async=!0;
      t.src=v;s=b.getElementsByTagName(e)[0];
      s.parentNode.insertBefore(t,s)}(window, document,'script',
      'https://connect.facebook.net/en_US/fbevents.js');
      fbq('init', 'xxxxxxxx');
      fbq('track', 'PageView');
      </script>
      <noscript><img height="1" width="1" style="display:none"
      src="https://www.facebook.com/tr?id=xxxxxx&ev=PageView&noscript=1"
      /></noscript>
      <!-- End Facebook Pixel Code -->

2. YouLi will install on your Trip Pages

YouLi Support staff will add the custom HTML Facebook pixel via Google Tag Manager Tag to fire on Page Views of pages that match:

/{teamalias}/

Where {teamalias} is what you set under your Account -> Site Settings

For example, for this Trip Page, runwildretreats is the {teamalias}:

https://trips.runwildretreat.com/t/runwildretreats/summer-2022

3. Once data is sending to Facebook, IF Prompted: Verify the Domain

This may not always be necessary - see if the data is coming to the pixel without it. This could take up to an hour.

Option 1: Grant YouLi access to verify the Domain

 

Option 2: Get DNS verification information from Facebook and provide to YouLi

Check your data feeds and if prompted, then get the DNS verification instructions and provide to YouLi via a help ticket.

name: HOW-TO: Filter your embedded trips on your website
title: HOW-TO: Filter your embedded trips on your website
body:
1. Get your embed script

If you haven't already done this, READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS

You should have code that looks a bit like this placed on your website:

<script src="https://youli.io/embeds/script/trips/mystic-adventures/?view=card&style=detailed"></script>

2. OPTIONAL: Limit the number returned

This can be useful on the homepage or if you have limited space to highlight trips and just want the trips that are coming up soon (up to the limit) to be shown.

In this example, the limit is 2, so only the first TWO trips with the nearest start date in the future, that are public & listed (and match any tags below), will be shown.

<script src="https://youli.io/embeds/script/trips/mystic-adventures/?view=card&style=detailed&limit=2"></script>

A number of 1 or greater is valid

3. Add the "tags" parameter

Now let's say that you want to ONLY show the "Adventure" trips on a particular page.

<script src="https://youli.io/embeds/script/trips/mystic-adventures/?view=card&style=detailed&tags=adventure"></script>

This will show ONLY the trips with tags of "Adventure". (You can set this on the OVERVIEW of the Trip when you edit it.)

4. Use a comma for more than one tag

If you want to ONLY show the "Adventure" trips IN CANADA on a particular page, then add the "Canada" tag, separated by a comma

<script src="https://youli.io/embeds/script/trips/mystic-adventures/?view=card&style=detailed&tags=adventure,canada"></script>

Remember that this is AND logic, so the returned trips must have BOTH tags set:

  • Adventure
  • Canada

5. Make sure your Trips have the right tags

  1. Click to your Trip
  2. Click the pencil icon to "Update Trip"
  3. Edit the list of Tags shown to include
    • Adventure
    • Canada
  4. Save Changes

TIPS

  • Tags are case insensitive, so "adventure", "Adventure", "ADVENTURE" are all the same
  • The trips must still match the embed rules
  • Advanced developers can create javascript filters to dynamically change the shown trips based on a user selected drop down of tags.
    • Here's an example: https://runwildretreats.com/about-the-run-wild-retreat-experience/levels/

name: New Features - Tags to organize and categorize your Trips - Release 1.115 - Aug 5th, 2021
title: New Features - Tags to organize and categorize your Trips - Release 1.115 - Aug 5th, 2021
body:
YouLi Delivers new functionality every month based on user feedback.

Sign up to get updates delivered to your inbox.

 

👉🏷👈🏾 The 10 Things I Love About My Trip

We have a favor to ask of you...spend a little time today thinking about how you want to categorize your trips. 

Then...ADD YOUR TAGS to each trip! (up to 10)

 

 

Why should you do this exercise?

It's not just for us, it's for you!! Here's 3 reasons you'll be glad you tagged up.

  1. Flexible Website Integration:
    • For example, in addition to the full list of Run Wild Retreats on their website, they can create individual pages dedicated to destinations or levels of running and show ONLY the trips that match.

  2. Organize: you can search based on the tags you add and filter on your dashboard to find the subset of trips with those tags
    • For example, if you work with a partner like Roam Beyond on certain trips, add "Rome Beyond" as a tag and then search for it on your dashboard to show JUST the trips you're doing in partnership with them.
  3. SEO: tags are recognized by the search bots like Google, so your brand gets additional SEO recognition on your YouLi hosted trip pages
    • For example, if, like Run Wild Retreats, you are hosting wellness trips, create tags like “running”, “retreat”, “wellness” to support your Google keyword search ranking.

 

TIP: To really boost your SEO, upgrade to an annual plan and add the White Label Domain add-on so that your trips are hosted on "trips.yourdomain.com" and add to your overall domain reputation on Google Search Console. Open a help ticket to request.

 

👉💰👈🏾 No Booking Fees on Direct Payments

You’ve always been able to provide Bank Transfer instructions. Now you can change the label and provide any kind of payment instructions you like.

Examples:

  • PO instructions
  • Venmo instructions
  • Wire Transfer

 

REMEMBER: Set a custom message to be sent along with the confirmation message when they click “Notify Planner”.

TIP: You can change the button label from “Notify Planner” under “Settings”

 

👉💰👈🏾To Pay or Not to Pay?

When a traveler registers for a trip with a deposit reminder set, YouLi sends up to 3 reminders on your behalf.

Sometimes people register for trips and then decide they don’t want to go. Now the email will be more clear about the option to “Pay” or “Decline”.

 

🔎🐜🔍 Always improving

We are always improving as we find little issues, here's a few we fixed:

  • When the Cybersource platform is not responding, still load the Trip Page and TripBoard - FIXED
  • Include Trip Name in Planner Notification when Main Contact is changed - FIXED

 

🔎🧁🔍 DO IT WITH TAGS: SEO Friendly Trip Summary 

Did you miss this? It's REALLY important - go do this NOW!

Ready to adopt the new Trip Card style? Great! But first you'll need to update your SHARE SUMMARY. 

Click to "UPDATE TRIP" and then scroll down to edit. 

NOTE: Max length is 150 characters to ensure it fits. So choose your words wisely!

--> Learn More about SHARE SUMMARY feature.

name: HOW-TO: Personalize an itinerary on a group trip
title: HOW-TO: Personalize an itinerary on a group trip
body:
There are many ways to customize trips for you travelers (whether they are traveling solo, in a group or have a shoulder trip planned!). Check out different options below. 

 

PERSONALIZED PRICE

For a traveler who is not yet registered for your trip:

1. Under "Manage People" click "Add person"

2. Scroll down in the pop-up and click on "Enable Personalized Price"

3. Add in their "Personalized Traveler Base Price" AND "Specific Explanation for this Traveler"

4. Click "Add" (to complete adding the traveler)

5. Share a magic link with your traveler & they will see that they are invited or registered (depending on what "Status" you chose for them) and they will see this personalized price & explanation under their invoice

 

For a traveler who has already registered for your trip:

1. Click "Manage People," find your traveler and click "Edit"

2. Now walk through steps 2-5 above!


EXTRA PACKAGE OPTIONS THAT ARE HIDDEN, BUT ASSIGNABLE, BY THE TRIP PLANNER


1. Click on "Update Trip" and then click on the "Pricing" tab. 

2. Make sure you are in "Bookings Mode" so that you can add a package (or edit an existing package!)

3. Click on the "Add Package" button OR click "Manage" > "Edit" under an existing package

4. Under "Visibility," choose "Hidden from travelers" (this package will no longer be visible / an option for anyone who has NOT already signed up for it)

 

Now to assign it to a traveler....

 

5. Under "Manage People" click "Add person"

6. Fill out your traveler's information, to register them for the trip. Under "Package" you will see your hidden package as visible and you can select it for them

7. Share a magic link with your traveler & they will see that they are already registered for that trip and can pay their deposit, see tasks, etc.!


PERSONALIZED ARRIVAL & DEPARTURE DATES

Click here for our help article, which will guide you on how to personalize your arrival & departure dates!


HIGHLIGHT & ITINERARY ITEMS THAT ARE VISIBLE TO CERTAIN PEOPLE OR EXCLUDE CERTAIN PEOPLE

1. Under "Manage Highlights & Itinerary" click "Add Item"

2. Scroll down to "Visibility" 

3. See options below. The default is that an itinerary / highlight item is visible to everyone. Instead, you can choose to "only show to" [and add in your traveler(s) name(s)] OR "show everyone except" [and add in those travelers you'd like to hide this itinerary / highlight item from]. 

4. Fill out all other details for the item and click "Publish" button

Note: If you've already created a highlight / itinerary item that you want to share with certain people, click "edit" below the item and walk through the steps above

TASKS & CUSTOM FORMS, WHICH ARE VISIBLE TO CERTAIN PEOPLE OR EXCLUDE CERTAIN PEOPLE

1. Under "Manage Tasks & Custom Forms," click "Add task"

2. Fill out all information for your task & find this section (see photo). Choose "Only show to" and start adding travelers that you'd like to show the task to. OR if you want this task hidden from some travelers, choose "Show everyone except." Note: The default setting is "Everyone Registered."

name: TROUBLESHOOTING: Embedded Trips
title: TROUBLESHOOTING: Embedded Trips
body:
TROUBLESHOOTING:

1. Do you have any Public AND Listed Trips?

If you don't see any trips after you've added the code, double check that you have trips that are Public AND Listed as listed in step 4 above.

The quickest way to check is to:

  1. Click on your account name in the upper right corner of the the application. It looks something like this: 
  2. Once clicked you'll see an option for WEBSITE
  3. Click on that to be taken to your collection of Public and Listed trips.

FIX: If there are none shown on your Plug N Play website, then update the trips you want to be Public and Listed before continuing to test the integration. You can always make a test trip and then archive it later.

2. Do you have any Public AND Listed Trips - that are in the future?

If the only Public AND Listed Trips you have in your account are in the past, they will be shown under the PAST tab on your Shop, but they will NOT appear on your website.

This can be confusing since the OPEN tab in this case is hidden, showing only the PAST trips.

FIX: Update the past trip to have future dates or estimated dates from inside the trip, make sure it is Public and Listed before continuing to test the integration. You can always make a simple test trip and then archive it later.

3. Do you have any Public AND Listed Trips - that are in NOT closed?

If the only Public AND Listed Trips you have in your account are closed to registrations, they will not be shown in your Shop but if embedded in your website it will still show. 

To re-open a trip, change the close date to a date in the future or clear it altogether.

4. Do you use WIX to host your website?

We now empower you to integrate your website on WIX. However, you do need to go through a few different steps. 

Copy your shop script from one of your trip pages and then paste it into your Wix website by adding an HTML frame. Be sure to put <p></p> in front of the script you copied from YouLi. And

<base target="_blank">

ABOVE the HTML Code. 

 

Watch the whole help video here: 

5. Are you not seeing your trip embedded? 

If you have a trip in “Brochure” mode that you don’t want listed on your shop, you can leave it as Public (and NOT Listed) and simply click COPY THIS TRIP to grab the snippet and embed it onto your website as a catalog of potential itineraries. This allows you to only make your set departure trips as Listed on your Shop since they can be booked immediately.

6. Don’t want to List your Brochure trips on your YouLi shop but want to embed on a landing page on your website?

If you have a trip in “Brochure” mode that you don’t want listed on your shop, you can leave it as Public (and NOT Listed) and simply click COPY THIS TRIP to grab the snippet and embed it onto your website as a catalog of potential itineraries. This allows you to only make your set departure trips as Listed on your Shop since they can be booked immediately.

7. Wordpress ONLY: Seeing your trip somewhere other than where you placed the snippet?

For Wordpress sites, if applicable, put the snippet in a Group block instead of a regular block. Otherwise the trip may appear at the bottom of the page or in an unexpected location.

8. Looking for another style?

Explore the embedded Trip Card styles available

name: HOW TO: Embed ALL of your listed trips into your own website
title: HOW TO: Embed ALL of your listed trips into your own website
body:
If you'd like to show ALL of your listed trips:

  1. Be sure that your Account Alias is set to a short name that you're happy with
  2. Click the SHARE TRIP button in the header of your tri
  3. Click INTEGRATE WITH WEBSITE
  4. Click EMBED ALL LISTED TRIPS  
  5. This will copy the code which shows ALL your Public and Listed trips so you can paste it onto your website.
  6. You or your website developer can paste the Website snippet into the page(s) at the location where you want your trips to be shown. Make sure you save your changes in your web editor to see your script run.  Learn more
  7. Want to customize the style or the number of trips? Learn more

 

 

--------

What is the difference between Private, Public, and Listed trips? 

Private: Trip cannot be seen by anyone, will not show on your YouLi shop and cannot be embedded. 

Public: When you mark your trip as Public you have the option of embedding a single trip onto your own website without it showing up in your set of Listed trips.

Listed: When you mark your trip as Public & Listed, the trip will show up anywhere you have put your embed code. Plus you have the option of embedding it as a single trip.

NOTE: Anytime you want to remove a trip from your website, simply uncheck the Listed option. It will immediately be removed once you save. 

 

Pro-Tip: If you have a single trip (either Brochure or Set Departure) embedded on your website, that trip will remain to show even after the date of the trip has passed. However, if it is Listed, it will disappear from your website once the date has passed.

-------

CLIENT EXAMPLE: RareAir Travel - YouLi Shop & Individual Trips Embedded

Website (YouLi Custom Web): https://rareairtravel.com.au

The website contains the general information about the company, but the itinerary specific information is hosted by YouLi Trips and embedded onto both the home page and the "Departures" page. 

YouLi Trips with White Label Domain: https://trips.rareairtravel.com.au/i/rareair

When customers click from the website to the YouLi hosted Trips, they still see the rareairtravel.com.au domain, so they trust they are booking from a trusted site.

Again, with the embed & White Label Domain feature customers won't know they are on another platform. 

If the above example of embedding the trip info and instead you just want to link from a landing page to the registration form on YouLi, watch this quick video.

Looking for additional help? Check out out embedded trips troubleshooting article!

name: HOW-TO: Embed a single YouLi trip into your own website
title: HOW-TO: Embed a single YouLi trip into your own website
body:
1. Set your Account Alias to a short name that you're happy with

2. Click the SHARE TRIP button in the header of your trip, then click INTEGRATE WITH WEBSITE

3. You or your website developer can paste this into the page(s) at the location where you want your trips to be shown. You want to click EMBED THIS TRIP. 

NOTE: You must save your changes in your web editor to see the script run

NOTE: For Wordpress sites, if applicable, be sure to put the snippet in a Group block instead of a regular block. Otherwise, the trip may appear at the bottom of the page.

4. For any Trips that you want to integrate, make them Public and Listed. This can be done under 'Update Trip' -> 'Overview' -> 'Trip Privacy'

Make sure it is a trip with a start date in the future or with estimated dates. Archived trips will not be shown.

-------

What is the difference between Private, Public, and Listed trips? 

Private: Trip cannot be seen by anyone, will not show on your YouLi shop and cannot be embedded. 

Public: When you mark your trip as Public you have the option of embedding a single trip onto your own website without it showing up in your set of Listed trips.

Listed: When you mark your trip as Public & Listed, the trip will show up anywhere you have put your embed code. Plus you have the option of embedding it as a single trip.

NOTE: Anytime you want to remove a trip from your website, simply uncheck the Listed option. It will immediately be removed once you save. 

 

Pro-Tip: If you have a single trip (either Brochure or Set Departure) embedded on your website, that trip will remain to show even after the date of the trip has passed. However, if it is Listed, it will disappear from your website once the date has passed.

-------

CLIENT EXAMPLE: RareAir Travel - YouLi Shop & Individual Trips Embedded

Website (YouLi Custom Web): https://rareairtravel.com.au

The website contains the general information about the company, but the itinerary specific information is hosted by YouLi Trips and embedded onto both the home page and the "Departures" page. 

YouLi Trips with White Label Domain: https://trips.rareairtravel.com.au/i/rareair

When customers click from the website to the YouLi hosted Trips, they still see the rareairtravel.com.au domain, so they trust they are booking from a trusted site.

Again, with the embed & White Label Domain feature customers won't know they are on another platform.

name: HOW-TO: Use Tags effectively to Categorize Trips on your Dashboard and Website
title: HOW-TO: Use Tags effectively to Categorize Trips on your Dashboard and Website
body:
Released in 1.115

Why do I need tags?

When you get more than a handful of trips, you'll need to start organizing them. To do this, you'll need to set "tags" on your trips.

This will allow you to:

  1. Include keywords for SEO on your Trip Page
  2. Split your embedded trips on your website
  3. Search for trips on your Dashboard

What is a tag?

Tags are a simple way to organize / categorize / group your trips.

Remember that this is not a name, instead it is a term that usually matches more than one of your trips.

Examples:

  • Adventure
  • Africa
  • High School
  • Private
  • VIP
  • Wedding

How to set your tags

You can only have 10 tags per trip, so choose wisely!

We provide you with a few hints to get you started, but you can add your own. 

You'll be prompted when making a trip, but don't worry, you can always edit later.

TIP: If you hit “backspace” when you’re in the tag text box, and it’s already empty, the last tag will become editable, and allow you to change it. This is for for accessibility (for keyboard-only users)
  1. Click to your Trip
  2. Click the pencil icon to "Update Trip"
  3. Edit the list of Tags shown to include
    • Adventure
    • Canada
  4. Save Changes

TIPS

  • Tags are case insensitive, so "adventure", "Adventure", "ADVENTURE" are all the same
  • The trips must still match the embed rules
  • Advanced developers can create javascript filters to dynamically change the shown trips based on a user selected drop down of tags.

How to use tags to filter your embed on your website

Normally when you copy to embed your full set of Listed trips it looks a bit like this

https://youli.io/embeds/script/trips/teamalias?view=card

If you want to further filter this down to a certain set of tags, add them like this

https://youli.io/embeds/script/trips/teamalias?view=card&tags=adventure,volunteering

READ MORE

name: HOW-TO Use Create Trip API to automate integration with CRM
title: HOW-TO Use Create Trip API to automate integration with CRM
body:
Create Trip API - CRM Integration

Supported Plans: ENTERPRISE ONLY

CreateTrip API Released in 2021 - read release notes

1.1.        Authentication

The current method of authentication is username and password with a Bearer Token

https://youlivetotravel.github.io/youli-doco/#authentication

Requests that require authentication will return 401 Not Authorized if the user has not authenticated.

2.     API Reference Documentation

2.1.        Create OR Update Trip

Creates a new Trip or updates an existing Trip if a valid trip ID is provided.

Note: If the trip ID is provided, then ALL values stored in Dynamics must be passed or they will be assumed to be blank and cleared/set to blank/NULL.

DO NOT just send what has been changed

 

2.2.        Resource Information

Method

Purpose

Response formats

JSON

Requires authentication?

Yes

Rate limited?

Yes

Requests

15/minute

 

 

2.3.        Request

Method

URL


POST


http://youli.io/api/trip/createtrip

 

 

 

Parameters

Automated payment reminders will only be enabled if due dates are set.

BUT: reminders are not sent until the contact accepts the quote/trip and changes their registration status from INVITED to REGISTERED.

Name

Type

Description

Required

 

Example

id

GUID

Unique Identifier for Trip generated by YouLi

No

blank => create
valid => update

 

bb29564e-86dd-e811-81ad-0638e1369576

templateId

GUID

Unique Identifier for a Template created in YouLi.

This will be ignored if an existing trip Id has been provided.

No

 

b77246b2-a0ab-eb11-a7ad-0003ffedcb08

isPublic

Boolean (true/false)

Flag to set visibility of trip

No, defaults to false

 

N/A

realignDates

Boolean (true/false)

Flag to align other trip dates if new startDate provided.

No, defaults to true

 

true

alias

String(256)

Must be unique for the authenticated trip owner.

Must only contain letters, numbers and hyphens.

Yes

 

tr2345678

name

String(80)

Does not have to be unique – but recommended for UX

Yes

 

Manchester Uni Winter Study Trip

mainContactEmail

String

Email address of the Main Contact for this Trip – must be Team Owner or Team Member in authenticated account or

Yes

 

mandy@yourteamdomain.com

overviewTitle

String

See below

No

 

Manchester University

tripTimeZone

String

Valid time zone in IANA or Windows format

Yes

 

 

startDate

date in ISO8601, no time zone

Date trip starts in time zone of trip

Required if End Date is provided.

No

 

2021-04-01T00:00:00

 

 

endDate

date in ISO8601, no time zone

Date trip ends in time zone of trip.

Must be after start date.

Required if Start Date is provided.

No

 

2021-04-21T00:00:00

primaryLocation

String(256)

Primary location of the trip. Other locations to be set on itinerary items. Used to center the map.

No

 

Arusha, Tanzania

OR

Sacramento, California, United States

currency

String(3)

3 char currency code

No

 

GBP

depositDueDate

date in ISO8601, no timezone

Date when deposit is due in time zone of trip – if set, automated reminders will be ON by default

No

 

2021-02-21T00:00:00

 

depositAmountPerPerson

decimal

Amount to be paid for deposit. Warning: this can be set to more than the traveler owes.

No

 

340

totalAmountPerPerson

decimal

Price per person used for the standard package. Can be amount for whole group if only one person added.

No, unless a depositAmountPerPerson is provided

 

3040

balanceDueDate

date in ISO8601, no time zone

Date when balance is due  in time zone of trip - if set, automated reminders will be ON by default

No

 

2021-06-21T00:00:00

 

primaryTravelerFirstName

String(100)

Add person to trip as invited traveler

No, unless primaryTravelerEmail is provided

 

Robin

primaryTravelerLastName

String(100)

Add person to trip as invited traveler

No

 

Kerr

primaryTravelerEmail

String(256)

Add person to trip as invited traveler

No, unless primaryTravelerFirstname is provided

 

bb@manchester.edu.uk

isPublic

Boolean (true/false)

Flag to set visibility of trip

No, defaults to false

 

true

requiredGroupSize

number

Set the “required group size” parameter for the pricing package. This will automatically add placeholders for this many people on the booking for the primary traveler and add them to their invitation group.

Max value is 50.

No

 

 

numTravelers

Number

Set the number of travelers for the pricing package.

 

If no totalAmountPerPerson has been provided on creation of a new trip, this parameter will be ignored.

No

 

32

overview

string

Overview of trip is shown on highlights of Trip Page.

Pass \ for new lines to be replaced by YouLi with <br>

No, can be blank

 

Departing from Manchester, United Kingdom

Number of paying passengers: 32 (30 students, 2 teachers)
Number of free spots: 1
Deposit per person: 340
Total per person: 3040

 

 

Note: If the trip time zone is not set to match the primary time zone provided, the Team Member will need to ensure the correct time zone is set in YouLi when editing the time zone. Itinerary specific time zones must be set on the itinerary item objects for flights and other items that occur in a different time zone than the primary location.

 

 

2.3.1.         Create – special handling

  • If totalAmountPerPerson and/or depositAmountPerPerson set:
    1. Add new trip cost instalment labeled “Deposit” with depositDueDate
    2. Add new trip cost instalment labeled “Balance Due” with balanceDueDate
  • Add a standard package labeled “Standard Package”
  1. Set trip to Bookings mode

 

2.3.2.         Update – special handling

  • If depositAmountPerPerson provided:
    1. Update trip cost instalment labeled “Deposit” with depositDueDate and depositAmount
    2. UNLESS no matching instalment found, then CREATE a new trip cost instalment labeled “Deposit”
  • If totalAmountPerPerson provided:
    1. Update the only pricing package on the trip
    2. Create a new standard pricing package if there is no package
  • Warning returned if more than one pricing package (trip update will still be completed)

 

 

 

2.4.        Authorization

The account on YouLi used to Authenticate must have permission to run this API under an Enterprise license.

2.5.        Response

If successful, this method returns a response body with the following structure:

 

Name

Type

Description

Total

Number

A number representing the number of results (always 1)

Results

Data

Data containing information about the created trip

 

The Results data will have the following structure:

Name

Type

Description

Id

GUID

GUID of the recently created or updated trip

plannerUrl

string

URL for planners to access and edit trip in YouLi (requires authentication) defaults to /EditSchedule

primaryMagicLink

string

Magic link for the primary traveler if provided

publicLink

string

Public share link for the trip if public (N/A for this integration since they will all be private)

2.5.1.         Sample Response

If successful, returns the HTTP status of 200 and a transaction object.

{

    "Total":1,
    "Results": {
        "Id": "341e71a2-489f-e711-8305-985fd3437709",
        "plannerUrl": "https://youli.io/Planner/PlannerEdit/341e71a2-489f-e711-8305-985fd3437709",
        "primaryMagicLink": "http://youli.io/t/sample/sample-trip/06826297-91eb-4e37-806b-70c1a08f657b",
        "publicShareLink": "http://youli.io/t/sample/sample-trip"
    }
}

2.5.2.         Status Codes

 

Status

Response

200

See above for sample response

200

{"warnings" : ["Could not update TotalAmountPerPerson because there are too many packages"]}

200

{"warnings" : ["Could not update MinTravelers because there are too many packages"]}

200

{"warnings" : ["Could not update MinTravelers because no TotalPricePerPerson has been provided"]}

200

{"warnings" : ["Could not update NumTravelers because there are too many packages"]}

200

{"warnings" : ["Could not update NumTravelers because no TotalPricePerPerson has been provided"]}

400

{“errors”: [“Please provide a valid templateId, set to null or omit. Empty string not valid”]}

400

{"errors" : ["Please provide a unique alias”]}

400

{"errors" : ["Alias must only contain letters, numbers and hyphens”]}

400

{"errors" : ["Please provide a valid time zone”]}

400

{"errors" : ["Please provide a valid planner email address for the mainContactEmail”]}

400

{"errors" : ["If End Date is provided, Start Date must be provided as well"]}

400

{"errors" : ["If Start Date is provided, End Date must be provided as well"]}

400

{“errors”: [“End Date must be greater than Start Date”]}

400

{"errors" : ["Please provide a valid tripId, set to null or omit. Empty string not valid"]}

400

{“errors” : [“If DepositDueDate is provided, DepositAmountPerPerson must be provided as well”]}

400

{“errors” : [“If DepositAmountPerPerson is provided, TotalAmountPerPerson must be provided as well”]}

400

{“errors” : [“If adding a primary traveler, please provide both PrimaryTravelerFirstName and PrimaryTravelerEmail fields”]}

400

{“errors” : [“RequiredGroupSize must be between 0 and 50 inclusive

”]}

400

In general, all validation errors will include a relevant error message

401

{"message" : "Authorization has been denied for this request."}

500

Response will be an error page (HTML)

 



Troubleshooting

ERROR: 400 Bad Request

If your JSON is valid and you still get a Bad Request response, be sure to check that the Main Contact email address is a valid YouLi Planner in your Team.

name: Upcoming Feature: Paying for optional add-ons with your deposit
title: Upcoming Feature: Paying for optional add-ons with your deposit
body:
This is a feature on the YouLi Roadmap for the future.

If you want to see this feature come to life, be sure to submit your 'vote' so that we prioritize it!

 

ISSUE: Overton Travel currently offers travel insurance as an optional add-on. However, travel insurance must be paid for at the time of purchase. Currently the only options available are (1) add it to the total cost of the trip or (2) make the insurance payable during the trip (once the traveler is already on it).

 

SUGGESTED SOLUTION: Allow travel protection / insurance to be added to the deposit amount due, at the time of booking, so that it can be paid for immediately when booking. Or, if the client adds on travel protection / insurance after the initial booking, there should be a separate line item for the travel protection and the payment is due now.

 

Want to pay to see this feature added?

Click "yes" under "Was this article helpful?" to let us know that you'd like this feature added to YouLi!

name: Upcoming Feature: Allow your clients to make payments for any amount, when they choose
title: Upcoming Feature: Allow your clients to make payments for any amount, when they choose
body:
This is a feature on the YouLi Roadmap for the future.

If you want to see this feature come to life, be sure to submit your 'vote' so that we prioritize it!

 

SUMMARY: Provide the ability for clients to make payments of any dollar amount when they choose

WHY?

  • For trips that have a deposit and final payment due, your clients may want to make interim payments between the deposit and final payment due date.

  • For trips that have monthly payment installments, your clients may want to make payments that are different than the monthly installment amount.

 

Want to pay to see this feature added?

Click "yes" under "Was this article helpful?" to let us know that you'd like this feature added to YouLi!

name: New Features - Invite Affiliates to get more bookings - Release 1.114 - July 21th, 2021
title: New Features - Invite Affiliates to get more bookings - Release 1.114 - July 21th, 2021
body:
YouLi Delivers new functionality every month based on user feedback.

Sign up to get updates delivered to your inbox.

 

👉💸👈🏾 Affiliate Dashboard Report

Learn more about the Affiliates feature.

Click to a REPORTS -> AFFILIATE REFERRALS (Don't see this, click HELP to request access)

As an Affiliate you will see:

  1. Trips you've sold bookings on
  2. Name of the travelers - linked to TripBoard
  3. Sale price
  4. Whether balance has been paid, is owing or cancelled 
  5. Commission accrued
  6. Date trip ends (commission paid after this date)
  7. Whether there are outstanding tasks to chase people about

 

As an Owner of Trips with Affiliates you will see:

  1. Affiliate Name (Code)
  2. Trip Name
  3. Name of the travelers - linked to TripBoard
  4. Sale price
  5. Whether balance has been paid, is owing or cancelled 
  6. Commission accrued
  7. Date trip ends (commission paid after this date)
  8. Whether there are outstanding tasks to chase people about

👉🔌👈🏾Affiliate co-branding & Back to People

As an Affiliate, when you click SHARE THIS TRIP and get your tracked link with your affiliate code, your customers will see your company logo alongside the operator's logo. In the example below the Trip is owned by the blue company and the Affiliate is the orange and red logo.

Also, to help you avoid registering people more than once, we added a shortcut to go "BACK TO PEOPLE" so you can see who needs to finish booking.

 

Learn more about being an Affiliate.

 

🔎🐜🔍 Always improving

We are always improving as we find little issues, here's a few we fixed:

  • After searching on Manage People, the default SEND INVITE message was not shown - FIXED - Thanks Lori!
  • Sometimes autofill would put people's phone numbers in their last name field - FIXED - Thanks Yirel!
  • When trip has double quotes in the name, the "Show registration on load" option in SHARE TRIP LINK was broken - FIXED - Thanks Vika!
  • The INVOICE used to show the price in the heading, which is below the invoice, which didn't make sense, so we removed it

 

🔎🧁🔍 FLASHBACK: SEO Friendly Trip Summary 

Did you miss this? It's REALLY important - go do this NOW!

Ready to adopt the new Trip Card style? Great! But first you'll need to update your SHARE SUMMARY. 

Click to "UPDATE TRIP" and then scroll down to edit. 

NOTE: Max length is 150 characters to ensure it fits. So choose your words wisely!

--> Learn More about SHARE SUMMARY feature.

name: New Features - Quotes & Affiliates to grow your business - Release 1.113 - July 7th, 2021
title: New Features - Quotes & Affiliates to grow your business - Release 1.113 - July 7th, 2021
body:
YouLi has a new logo!

 

 

YouLi Delivers new functionality every month based on user feedback. So be sure to sign up to get updates delivered to your inbox.

 

👉📧👈🏾 Quotes for Corporates, Schools + Churches

1. Use the CreateTrip API to connect from your CRM to YouLi

2. Be sure to set the "numTravelers" parameter

3. Want to create some options? Copy the default package and change the price and number of travelers to allow your buyer to make the best choice

 

👉✏️👈🏾 Customize your Trip Page even more

Click to a Trip -> Update Trip -> Settings and you'll discover a few more ways to create the perfect experience on your trips.

  1. When someone declines on the trip, change the prompt from "You're not going to" 
    • Suggestions: "Quote declined for:", "You have cancelled your booking for:", "你不去"

  2. Your packages show a "per person" price, now you can change the label
    • Suggestions: "por persona", "pp", "per human", "每人"

 

👉💸👈🏾Affiliates can SEND MESSAGE

Have you scaled up to use agents to sell more spots on your trips? 

Did you know you can invite them as "Affiliates" to grab a tracked link and YouLi will report who has sold which spots?

Affiliates can also click to see their bookings and now they can SEND MESSAGE from their address to their client and help you manage the booking.

Make them earn their commission and chase all the payments and documents!

 

🔎🌅🔍 SEO Optimization 

Size matters when it comes to SEO and over 50% of your Trip Page is images. So we're implementing optimizations to ensure the smallest possible image is served without reducing the quality of the experience.

 

🔎🐜🔍 Always improving

We are always improving as we find little issues, here's a few we fixed:

  • Converting an itinerary item with a time to estimated date was picking the wrong DAY - FIXED!

 

🔎🧁🔍 FLASHBACK: SEO Friendly Trip Summary 

Did you miss this? It's REALLY important - go do this NOW!

Ready to adopt the new Trip Card style? Great! But first you'll need to update your SHARE SUMMARY. 

Click to "UPDATE TRIP" and then scroll down to edit. 

NOTE: Max length is 150 characters to ensure it fits. So choose your words wisely!

--> Learn More about SHARE SUMMARY feature.

name: New Features - Custom Email Templates & Automated Reminder Fixes - Release 1.112 - June 24th, 2021
title: New Features - Custom Email Templates & Automated Reminder Fixes - Release 1.112 - June 24th, 2021
body:
Are you ready to re-launch your business and take bookings for the coming travel recovery?
Be inspired by the stories of travel recovery...

 

YouLi Delivers new functionality every month based on user feedback. So be sure to sign up to get updates delivered to your inbox.

 

👉📧👈🏾 Automated Emails - Default & Custom Templates

Out of the box, YouLi sends MANY automated emails on your behalf. You can read about all the confirmation and reminder emails we send. You can configure these emails through the platform at no additional cost. 

Recently we've been getting requests to create customized versions of some templates, like the invoice that is sent when a Traveler or Planner requests a receipt.

For example, including extra information in the receipt like:

  • Number of Days
  • Room number
  • Booking Date
  • Package description

We can customize these templates for a fee, just open a support request to get more information. (available on white label domain account only)

BONUS: If you have a finance, billing or reservation address that needs a copy of these receipts, that option is now available. (fees apply)

 

📈📈📈 Analytics are your friend (seriously)

As our friend Natasha from System Rocks is well aware, analytics makes the difference when you're planning how to spend marketing dollars and what strategies are working/not working.

 

That's why we are always improving the source tracking so your data has even more insights.

When an email is sent from YouLi to your travelers, we add the following utm parameters:

  • utm_source=youli
  • utm_medium=email
  • utm_campaign=${Trip Short Name}

You'll see this information in your acquisition reports in Google Analytics. Be sure to setup your code!

 

👉💸💸 Automated Payment Reminders 

Previously, YouLi would send an automated payment reminder to people who had a "PENDING" payment that needed to be confirmed by the Planner.

Thanks to feedback from Kim @ Pristine Trails, we are no longer sending reminders as long as the traveler has told us the payment is on the way.

🐜 We have also fixed some special cases where people still got reminders even if they did not owe for that particular installment. 

--> Learn more about automated payment reminders

 

🔎🐜🔍 Fixing things along the way 

We are always improving as we find little issues, here's a few we fixed:

  • Ever see your Trip Page banner image change revert to the old image? FIXED
  • We now log to the Activity Feed when you EDIT PRICE from Manage Payments, so we can troubleshoot when personalized prices get messy! (Thanks Nick)
  • When adding payments or credits from the TripBoard:
    • Avoid certain rounding issues FIXED
    • Default to the balance due for the entire invitation group
  • Did you check the "show registration" box on the SHARE LINK popup and find it didn't work? FIXED

 

🔎🧁🔍 FLASHBACK: SEO Friendly Trip Summary 

Did you miss this in the last release? It's REALLY important - go do this NOW!

Ready to adopt the new Trip Card style? Great! But first you'll need to update your SHARE SUMMARY. 

Click to "UPDATE TRIP" and then scroll down to edit. 

NOTE: Max length is 150 characters to ensure it fits. So choose your words wisely!

--> Learn More about SHARE SUMMARY feature.

name: HOW-TO: Request that your travelers pay their deposit immediately
title: HOW-TO: Request that your travelers pay their deposit immediately
body:
YouLi prompts your travelers to register first, so that you can capture their information even if they get distracted while checking out. Otherwise, you may find yourself in a situation where people abandon the checkout process and you don't know who they are.

You can set your call to action [CTA] to be BOOK NOW and you can set up your deposit to be due "X days from registration," which means it will prompt them to pay as soon as they register. 

Under "Update Trip" > "Settings," you can change the button label for that from "VIEW PAYMENT OPTIONS" to anything you prefer.


You can also set the text to show in a popup explaining that they need to pay their deposit to continue, if you ​feel the default flow is not clear enough:
​
Don't worry, if they don't immediately pay their deposit they will be sent 3 reminders to come back and do so if you have automated reminders turned on.

Tip: If you set the due date to 0 days, your travelers will be sent reminders right away!

We strongly recommend going through the checkout process as a traveler to see how it works and adjust what you need. Use the "Bank Transfer" payment method to go through the full flow including booking without having to use a credit card.

name: CHECKLIST: Create a trip page in "brochure mode"
title: CHECKLIST: Create a trip page in "brochure mode"
body:
It's easy to create a trip page that will ONLY gather interest from your customers, by displaying a captivating itinerary, but NOT accepting bookings. This option is great for trip planners who want to share trip options with their clients, where they can respond with what packages, activities, etc. they are interested in adding to their trip (the trip planner using this feedback to then create a customized trip). Follow this checklist to learn how to set up a trip page in "brochure mode."

STEP 1: CREATE A TRIP

The choice is yours! Make the trip page 'public' so that people can click on a shared link & view it.
Note: you can make it 'listed' if you want to embed the trip page into your website

Alternatively, if you choose to set your trip as 'private,' you can share a magic link with anyone that your trip is meant for.

 

STEP 2: ENABLE 'BROCHURE MODE' UNDER THE 'PRICING' TAB

FOR A NEW TRIP:

  • Click on "Set a Price" in the header 
  • Click "USE BROCHURE MODE"

 

If you have an existing trip, you can always change it back to BROCHURE MODE:

   -It should say "Not taking payments"
   -Update the "Estimated Price" field
   -Update the "Pricing Section Heading" field
   -Update the "Pricing Explanation" field
   -Make sure to click "Save Changes" (upper right)

 

STEP 3: SET UP YOUR BOTTONS AND REGISTRATION FORM OPTIONS, UNDER 'SETTINGS'

Note: This step is still important, even in brochure mode. In YouLi, a traveler registering is their expression of interest -- their intention to go on a particular trip!

-Update your "Register Button Label" field (i.e. "Express Interest")
-Ask them a question in the "Comment Prompt" field (i.e. "Tell us which activity looks most exciting!")
-Add in your Privacy & Terms, for your travelers to consent to
-Allow your travelers to register in pairs or groups (what we call 'invitation groups')

OPTIONAL things that you can also do:

Option No. 1: Turn off any extra menu items you don't need and do not want visible to your registered travelers
Option No. 2: Assign tasks for form completion and travel document collection

Option No. 3: On any of our premium plans you can switch between 'brochure mode' and 'bookings mode' on any of your trip pages 


STEP 5: TEST OUT WHAT YOUR TRAVELERS WILL EXPERIENCE

1. Click "Share Link" 
​​
To view this trip page as the public would (someone who is NOT registered):

2. Click the copy icon on the right (two rectangles)
3. Paste the link into a new browser tab
4. Go through the flow as your traveler would!
​​​
However, if you set your trip page to 'private' and you want to view the trip page as a specific person (to see the trip page from their perspective), click on the 'Get Magic Link for a specific person' dropdown and choose a traveler.

Again here, go through the flow as your traveler would!


STEP 6: IF A TRIP PAGE IS 'PUBLIC,' SHARE YOUR LINK ON SOCIAL MEDIA, EMAIL IT TO PEOPLE OR LINK IT FROM YOUR WEBSITE, TO START COLLECTING EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST

Be sure to update your SHARE SUMMARY to improve the way your trip pages appear on social media posts.

name: Protect your customers: DO NOT store credit card data
title: Protect your customers: DO NOT store credit card data
body:
To preserve the security of your customer's data, we urge you to NOT store their credit card information within YouLi - we integrate with Payment Gateways that can do this securely for you. 

Some things to be aware of:

  1. If you accept credit or debit cards, PCI Security Standards apply to you. Even if your customers ask you to store their credit card data, you shouldn't. 

  2. Both Stripe and Square are PCI-compliant payment processors. They have specialized security controls to secure customers’ data, and therefore you lessen the risks involved in storing credit card data. This is why we utilize these payment processors for traveler bookings!

    • Auto-charge is a feature to re-use securely stored credit cards to pay on an instalment plan. 

  3. NEVER collect credit card information using a text field (any field in the tasks forms). Fun Fact: Even an encrypted text field doesn’t comply with PCI standards. So ALWAYS use a credit card-specific field.

  4. You should NOT store credit card information in a planner note, form builder, a spreadsheet, database or on a piece of paper. None of these options are safe, nor are they PCI-compliant.

Convenience vs. Security

We understand that the travel industry has operated by sharing credit card information in a more casual way, which is why we wrote this article. 

As a platform, we take our responsibility as your data stewards to help you be safe and keep the data of your customers safe. No matter how much it seems like the convenience of writing down their credit card outweighs the risk of capturing this information in a way that can be stolen - IT NEVER IS!

Your customer might be annoyed they have to click to a form and enter their credit card information right now - but they would be even angrier if a data breach caused them to have their identity stolen and fraudulent charges made.

If your team is struggling to find a way to service your clients without storing credit card numbers outside of a payment gateway (Stripe, Square, etc), please be in touch with our team and we can discuss your digital transformation to a more secure business process.

name: CHECKLIST: Create a trip page in "bookings mode"
title: CHECKLIST: Create a trip page in "bookings mode"
body:
It's easy to create a trip page which will accept bookings & get you paid! Follow this checklist to learn how to set up a trip page in "bookings mode."

Step 1: Create a trip page & make it public

Make the trip page 'public' so that people can click on a shared link & view it.
Note: you can make it 'listed' if you want to embed the trip page into your website

 

Step 2: Enable Bookings mode under "Pricing" 

   -It should say "Payments Enabled"
   -Add at least one pricing package
   -Select at least one payment method

 

Step 3: Set up your buttons and registration form options

 

Step 4: Decide if you want a popup to explain the payment process or simply have that message emailed to your travelers after registration

OPTIONAL things you can also do:

Option No. 1: Set installments if you want them to pay a deposit 
Option No. 2: Turn on automated reminders so that if your travelers DO NOT pay immediately, they receive 3 email reminders

Option No. 3: Turn off any extra menu items you don't need and do not want visible to your registered travelers


Step 5: Test out what your travelers will experience

-Click "Share Link" 
​​
-Click the "Show registration" option, in order to make the registration form pop up, as soon as your traveler loads the trip page
-Click the copy icon on the right (two rectangles)
​​​
-Paste the link into a new browser tab
-Go through the flow as your traveler would!

Note: you can always delete the registration after you've tested it & confirm that it works as desired


Step 6: Share your link on social media, email it to people or link from your website to start taking bookings

Be sure to update your SHARE SUMMARY to improve the way your trip pages appear on social media posts.

name: Instruct your travelers to pay their deposit after a trip planner has approved their application
title: Instruct your travelers to pay their deposit after a trip planner has approved their application
body:
If you would like to require that your (potential) travelers first express interest in a trip, followed by completing a task to apply, followed by being asked to pay their deposit (after their application is reviewed & approved), see here for details on how to make this happen!

Before we start, if you need help creating an application, check out our how-to article on custom forms!

 

Back to utilizing applications for traveler approval, there are two ways to do this:
1. Keep the trip in bookings mode and explain to your (soon-to-be) travelers that they need to apply first. Here's a [13 min] video recording of how you might do that.

2. You can create two trips: one in brochure mode that is public & listed, where you are taking expressions of interest (and qualifying) and then a second one, a (private) copy of that same trip page and have it in bookings mode (so that only once your traveler is qualified, they are able to pay).  

Here’s what that would look like: 
1. Under your trip page that is in brochure mode, your traveler clicks “apply" (this is your call to action button)
2. They are then prompted to complete the application form
3. Review their response and choose to accept or deny them. If you accept them: Add them to the other trip (which you've copied & made private) and send them a message to pay their deposit on the private trip. Delete the traveler from the trip they expressed interest in (under “manage people”). If you deny them, then mark them as status as "declined" and leave yourself and / or the trip planner a note as to why they were denied.
