HOW-TO Cost Explanation & Menu @ YouLi Travel Experience Platform

name: Itinerary & Highlights | Optional Items & Add-ons to the Invoice
title: Itinerary & Highlights | Optional Items & Add-ons to the Invoice
body:
Optional Items and Add-Ons are a YouLi feature that allows you to make Itinerary Items opt-in for your travelers. 

 

You can make a Highlight or Itinerary Item Optional with just a click of a button.

 

There are two types of Optional Items:

  1. Add-on prepaid prior to trip: a price is required and will be added to the traveler invoice when selected. (as of 1.85, March 2020)
    • Examples
      • Hot Air Balloon Ride +$500
      • All Inclusive Option +$2000
      • Single Supplement +500
      • Discount for Early Bird -$250 with response due date set to expiration of Early Bird Offer
  2. Free or pay on the day: a description of any cost (could be FREE) will be displayed to the traveler, but it will NOT change the price on the invoice.
    • Examples
      • FREE night tour of markets
      • Group lunch, not included, bring cash
      • Extra coaching session, pay in cash based on coach's rate/availability
      • Optional hike, bring cash for guide tip US$25 each

 

What does an Optional Item look like for the traveler? 

Optional Items look similar to included Highlights & Itinerary Items.

The ONLY difference is that there is a checkbox in the right upper corner, where they can click to select or de-select it for themselves and their invitation group.

When you make a Highlight or Itinerary Item Optional, your traveler has the option to respond YES, NO or clear their response.

It looks slightly different on the Invoice:

On Highlights:

And on the Itinerary

Here is what an Optional Item (not an Add-on) shown on Highlights looks like: 

 

Discover how you can default your optional item to selected when your traveler registers on your trip. 

 

Can a traveler select different responses for the same Add-on for different members of their invitation group?

Not at this time. Right now, all members of the same invitation group get the Add-on if it is selected by any member of the invitation group.

This is on the roadmap to be fixed soon.

 

Can a traveler select an Add-on after they pay their deposit?

Yes! They can select an add-on as long as the due date for the item and the Close Registrations for the trip have not passed.

 

How do I make a Highlight or Itinerary Item Optional?

When you create a new Item or edit an existing Item, you will see a box underneath the Start Date & End Date where you can set the ITEM PRICE.

Select the type of optional that you need for this item:

 

When one of your travelers selects an optional item, you will see their response. Click on the number of responses to see who has responded, export the list and send them personalised messages.

 

PLUS, did you know you can manually message the travelers on your optional items? Check it out here in our help video: How To Send a Manual Message To Travelers on Optional Items

name: What is an Invitation Group?
title: What is an Invitation Group?
body:
YouLi Trips is optimized for groups of people traveling, especially for a shared purpose. In many cases, each individual will be handling their own payments and tasks, like a group of solo travelers.

However, if you cater to couples, families or teams, then you need Invitation Groups.

 

You can update your Trip Page settings to allow your travelers to register in an invitation group. When a traveler registers with extra people, they are automatically added to the same Invitation Group. Discover how you can update your invitation group settings to ensure your travelers share with you the information you need!

 

As the planner, you have the ability to edit and manage invitation groups. You can change the Invitation Group name after the registration is made without breaking the group.

 

All the people in an Invitation Group must pay together. All the members can also complete tasks on behalf of other members. This is helpful when one partner does all the admin work (like passports and visas) for the other, other if there are children in the party.

What can they do?

When people are in the same Invitation Group, they can:

  • Pay altogether from one invoice
  • Respond to optional items together
  • Complete each other's tasks

Only one member of the Invitation Group needs to have an email address set. This is especially useful for couples and families with children. 

It is also ok if all members have an email provided, whoever clicks through on the notification to pay or complete the task will be allowed to do so.

Who can create an Invitation Group?

> Travelers 

If you have said 'Yes' to allow your travelers to register in invitation groups, you'll be able to set the number of people that can be added to an Invitation Group created by your Travelers.

To learn more about how you can customize your Trip Page and your travelers experience in Understanding 'Allow travelers to register in an invitation group'. 

> Planners

As a Trip Owner or Co-Planner you have complete control over who is in the group and you'll see this under Manage People. 

See the example in the screenshot below.

Want to manually create an invitation group? All Planners can create an Invitation Group from the Manage People. Get a walkthrough guide in our how-to video about invitation groups. 

Need to manually add a payment for your invitation group? Watch our video of how to add a manual payment for invitation groups.

name: Multi-registration (groups within a group), how to 'Allow travelers to register their own Invitation Group'
title: Multi-registration (groups within a group), how to 'Allow travelers to register their own Invitation Group'
body:
On Premium plans, you can quickly allow your travelers to register as a group on a Trip under
UPDATE TRIP -> SETTINGS. This is a powerful way for you to have travelers pay together.

 

NOTE: This feature was previously called "Extra Registrations" and looked like this:

Due to customer feedback, we have revised this feature to be easier to use.

 

Allow Travelers to register in Invitation Groups?

When you go to UPDATE TRIP > SETTINGS you have the ability as the planner to allow your travelers to register in an invitation group. Not sure what an invitation group is? Explore our help doc 'What is an invitation group'?

 

There are two options: 

No - travelers can only register solo

Yes - travelers can register in groups of up to the number set

 

 

If you choose 'Yes' you will be able to customize your invitation group settings:  

 

> Maximum Number of People

By default, a trip will have "1" selected.

To allow your Travelers to book on behalf of their family or friends, simply select the MAXIMUM number of allowed.

  • 2 = couples or friends, but people can also register solo
  • 3 = small group of friends or family, can register as 1, 2 or 3 people
  • ...
  • 10 = largest group/team, can register as 1, 2, 3 or up to 10 people in one group

Choosing any number greater than 2 prompts for additional information. 

All these fields can be left as default if you aren't sure.

 

 

> Label for Number in Group

What do you call your groups? This is where you can personalize the prompt your travelers see to enter the number of people in their group.

Some example prompts:

  • Select 1 to book solo, 2 for couples
  • Size of Team
  • Number in Party
  • How many people are traveling?

 

> Label for Name of Group

How do you want to ask your traveler to provide a name for their group? This is where you can customize the prompt your travelers see as for what they should name their group. 

Some example prompts:

  • Family Name
  • Team Name
  • Nickname

You also have the option to show the Group Name instead of Full Name on the Trip Page. Check this box if you want to hide the individual names of your travelers but want to show the Group Name.

Take note, you can personalize the Menu you have on your Trip Page too. So, if you hide the people tab, this feature will be hidden from your travelers. 

 

 

> Label for Member of the Group

How do you want to ask your traveler to provide a name for each member of the group? This is the prompt your travelers will see as for who (the name/names) they should be adding to their group. 

Some example prompts:

  • Family Member
  • Team Member
  • Partner
  • Companion
  • Friend

 

> Instructions

This text will appear to prompt the person to enter the names of their companions. Email addresses are not required for the extra registrations so they can quickly register and pay a deposit. 

They can always add an email later when editing their companion's profiles.

 

 

How will it look to Travelers?

Once a Planner has allowed travelers to register as Invitation Groups, they will see the options below when they click the button to register.

In this example, the Traveler has selected 2, so they are prompted to enter the name of their companion.

This is where the instructions provided earlier will appear.

The owner of the group must enter a name, but emails are NOT required. These can be populated after registration.

 

NOTE: If the Traveler has ALREADY registered, you can manually add people to their Invitation Group, but they cannot add them directly.

 

Learn more about 'what is an invitation group'? 

 

Want a deeper dive? Watch our How-To allow travelers to sign up in invitation groups help video:

name: Trip Page Contact
title: Trip Page Contact
body:
You can have many Co-Planners helping you make the magic happen, but not all of them should be visible to your travelers. 

If you are collaborating with another brand or even within your own team, you can invite them to co-plan on the trip and then add them as a Trip Page Contact. All Trip Page Contacts will receive email updates when travelers sign up, make payments, or complete tasks. 

  1. Click into your trip
  2. Click to "Manage Planners" on the left menu at the bottom to access the TRIP PLANNERS
  3. Check if the User is listed, if not, add them
  4. If so, check their TRIP PAGE CONTACT is Yes, if not, click the pencil to edit

When editing, look for this option, set to YES to make them a TRIP PAGE CONTACT:

Once you save your changes, they will become a TRIP PAGE CONTACT.

What does this enable?

They can send messages as themselves from YouLi

Anywhere you can select a traveler and click SEND MESSAGE will prompt you to select who to SEND FROM. The people listed in the drop down are the TRIP PAGE CONTACTS.

They will be listed on the Trip Page as a Contact

NOTE: Be sure they have updated their Avatar (Profile Image) and contact information by clicking into their Account from the menu.

name: Trip Coordinator User Role
title: Trip Coordinator User Role
body:
This was previously called Trip Leader.

This is both a Role and a Subscription. So once an email address is assigned to be a Trip Coordinator, they cannot have any other Role and CANNOT make their own trips.

Explore all the Team Roles you can assign in YouLi as the Main Contact. 

 

Who is this for?

You will want to invite a Trip Coordinator to your trip when you are working with someone that needs to see all the information across all your travelers, but should not be able to make changes to the itinerary or other Trip information.

Usually the Trip Coordinator will go on the trip as well, in that case, they must also be added to the Trip as a traveler.

Examples include:

  • Ground tour operator
  • Guide
  • Group Leader
    • Professor
    • Teacher
    • Coach
    • Manager
  • Executive Assistant

 

Access Permissions

As a Trip Coordinator, the User has a VIEW ONLY role, so they will only be able to:

  1. VIEW all information about the Trip
    1. Preview Travel Page
    2. Share Trip Link
    3. Invited travelers
    4. Itinerary (Program and Detailed items)
      • Optional itinerary responses
    5. Tasks
      • Task responses
    6. Resources
      • Trip resources provided by Planner to travelers
      • Documents uploaded by travelers in response to Tasks
  2. Send Messages from themselves
    1. Resend invites to existing invited travelers
    2. Send update messages
    3. Send reminders for
      • Optional itinerary items
      • Tasks
  3. Download documents and manifests
    1. All documents from Resources
    2. Manifest of all travelers from Manage People
    3. Manifest from optional itinerary items
    4. Manifest from completed tasks

TIP: The Trip Owner will be able to send messages as if they were the Trip Coordinator since they may get better responses from people if they get the message from someone they know.

 

Where do I add a Trip Coordinator?

Trip Coordinators are added to Trips by the Trip Owner or Co-Planner from Trip->Manage Planners->Trip Planners.

 

 Want to see what you trip coordinator sees on the admin side of YouLi? Watch our YouLi How-To Video on How To Add A Trip Coordinator.

name: Trip Users - Role Overview - Edit OR View Only
title: Trip Users - Role Overview - Edit OR View Only
body:
Take advantage of all the work you've put into your Trip by having people help you plan. 

If you are a Co-Planner on the Trip, you can add Trip Users to your Trip with the following Roles:

  1. Trip Coordinator - VIEW ONLY
  2. Co-Planner - EDIT
  3. Existing Team Members can be added to this Trip, but adding a new Team Member must be done by the Team Owner in their Account.

You cannot switch between roles once selected, so choose wisely!

The other types of Trip Users you'll see in the table

  1. Trip Owner
  2. Team Admin - [ENTERPRISE ONLY] This account type gives a team member access to edit all the things under "account" that the Team Owner can edit: branding, payments, team, and affiliates.

You'll also see that ONE of the Trip Users is the Main Contact.

 

As always, use the in app chat or open a ticket for extra help.

name: Add Person - Managing People For Public And Private Trips
title: Add Person - Managing People For Public And Private Trips
body:
What does it mean for a traveler to be "registered" on a trip? It means that their name has been added to the Trip under Manage People & they are selected as Yes. 

 

The reason why this matters is that YouLi Trip Pages can present different versions of the same itinerary to different people. You can use YouLi for static itineraries, but it can do far more once you take advantage of the optional items in the Plan, customize their costs, put them in Invitation Groups, and assign them Tasks. All of these variations require that people are added to the trip in some way.

 

If they are under 'Registered' but labeled as 'not responded' then they have just been Invited on the trip & not confirmed as Registered or not confirmed as going on the trip. 

 

There are three ways to add people:

  1. A Planner can click 'Add People' from Manage People 
  2. A Planner can Bulk Upload people
  3. The traveler registers themselves directly on a Public Trip 
    • You can allow them to register as a couple, family, or team

 

Which option is right for you? Read on to find out.

This article is referring to the Private/Public option when you are Updating your Trip, it looks like this:

 

Is your Trip Private?

If your trip is for a dedicated group and you don't want just anyone to be able to register: Make the Trip Private.

When a Trip is Private, only the people shown under Manage People can view the Trip Page using their Magic Links. 

So the Planner (you) will need to add them either one at a time or using Bulk Upload. You can manually add a traveler by going to Manage People and then selecting the add person button in the right hand corner. 

NOTE: You'll need to explicitly Send Invite once you've added them so they get their Magic Link. See what emails will be sent when you Send Message or Send Invite.  

 

When you add people, they are added with one of three options for "Registered?":

  1. Not Responded
    • They have been invited but have not confirmed their interest or attendance. Use this if you want the person to take action and click the button in the footer of the Trip Page to let you know they are serious. They will not be prompted to take any other action until they register
    • People who register directly on a Public Trip are never in this state
  2. Yes 
    • If you know they are already committed to going and you just need them to complete payment and or tasks as configured on the trip, then this is the right option.
    • People who register directly on a Public Trip are automatically in this state when they click the right button - you can configure the Call to Action of that button, but it always appears as 'Yes' under Manage People.
    • Enabled Reminders for due payments and tasks will be sent if an email is provided
  3. No
    • If you know they cannot attend, this is the right option
    • This can be an alternative to deleting a person if they have made a payment already but they change their mind
    • They can select this by clicking the No button when they are invited OR
    • They can change their mind after registering under their Edit Profile on the Trip Page
    • You can change this under Manage People -> EDIT for the person
    • NO Reminders for due payments and tasks will be sent to this person

 

Is your Trip semi-Private?

However, if you have a specific group who should be allowed to register, but you don't want to do that work, then you can make your people do it.

In this case, you probably need a Public Trip, but you don't want to "List it on Your Shop", so leave that option unchecked. So they will not appear in your Trip Shop and they will not appear on your website (see below for more on this).

Note that this option should only be used if you don't mind that anyone with the Trip Share Link can view your itinerary. This is similar to the way that 'Unlisted' works on YouTube or the 'Anyone with this link can view this document' on file sharing sites.

 

 

Is your Trip open to everyone?

Finally, if you're publicly advertising your trip, then you definitely want a Public trip. 

A Public trip should only be used if you don't mind that anyone with the Trip Share Link can view your itinerary. Click on the 'SHARE TRIP' button in the Trip Header to get the Share Link.

 

You'll also want to "List it on Your Shop"

So be sure to check that option when you're ready to share with the world.

Selecting that option means:

  1. The trip will appear on Your Shop, which is linked from the menu in the upper right.
  2. It will also appear on your website if you are fully integrated. 

Note that only trips in the future are shown, they are automatically removed when the start date passes. 

 

A Trip Share Link typically looks like:

https://youli.io/t/[Account-Alias]/[Trip Alias]

For example:

https://youli.io/t/mystic-adventures/jordan-demo-adv

A Trip Shop Link typically looks like this example:

https://youli.io/i/best-life-adventures

name: Open a Ticket
title: Open a Ticket
body:
Can't find the answer you need? Open a ticket, simply click the "submit request" link above.

During Australian business hours you can also open a chat inside the platform by clicking the bubble in the lower right corner.

Common reasons to open tickets:

  • Upload a list of people to a trip - if you have too many to do manually, we are happy to help 
  • Get you started with a trip - if you have an existing plan or website with content, we can help you get your trip setup, just open a ticket with the content and we will do our best to bring your idea to life on YouLi
  • Connect to Square - Stripe is our preferred gateway, if you prefer Square, let us know and we'll enable the option
  • Feature request - are you missing something essential? Tell us and you might find it in the next release notes. No harm is asking :-)
  • Delete a trip - there's no going back, so be sure!
  • Delete an account - there is REALLY no going back, but we understand it happens

name: Group Trip - Send Invitation & Send Message - Email Templates
title: Group Trip - Send Invitation & Send Message - Email Templates
body:
Welcome to YouLi! The best group trip planning software.

We empower trip planners to create beautiful itineraries, get paid easily, and also conveniently communicate with your travelers in one place!

Sign up and explore for free.

 

In this help document, we cover how you can easily send an invitation and send a message to your travelers through YouLi so they can access their personalized Trip Page. Discover more information on our automatic payment and task reminders here. 

When sending messages to via YouLi, email templates are used to save you time and ensure the messages look good on all devices.

In this example template for the messages, you can see what is changed for each Planner, Trip, and Traveler. The dynamic parts are highlighted with boxes. Everything else is the same for all YouLi clients, but see below for information on customized templates!

  • The green boxes show things set by the Planner Account that is the Trip Owner, like From Name and Email Address.
  • The orange boxes show things that are set on the Trip, like name and banner image.
  • The pink boxes show things that are set for the person receiving the message, like their Full Name and their "Magic Link" to their personalized Travel Page.
  • The blue box shows the message entered before sending.

Customized Templates

Customized templates, like the invoice that is sent when a traveler or planner requests a receipt, can be provided for a fee (for white label domain accounts ONLY), contact us for pricing.

For example, including extra information in the receipt like:

  • Number of Days
  • Room number
  • Booking Date
  • Package description

BONUS: If you have a finance, billing or reservation address that needs a copy of these receipts, that option is now available. (fees apply)

Read on for more details...

TIP: We recommend you create a test trip and add yourself as a person to test out how the messages will appear for your account.

There are two messaging buttons under 'Manage People'. "Send Invite" and "Send Message". The main difference between them is the subject line and the label on the button in the email they receive. 

Also, Send Invite has a default value to save you time since your invitation message will frequently be the same for everyone even though you may not send them all at the same time.

Send Invite

After selecting the right people from the list, click the "Send Invite" button to send a message with the default set to the last message.

You'll be prompted to:

1. Review the people, cancel if you don't see the right people's names

  • The example below shows 1 person missing an email address, you can cancel to correct or just send to the 9 with email addresses


2. Choose your sending address (defaults to you or the Trip Owner)

3. Edit your message

  • Remember that each person gets their own copy, so no need to include their name
  • Changing the message only effects this send, next time the message will reset to the default
  • The default comes from the 'Update Trip'->'Settings'->'Message sent with invitation'

4. Click "Send Now"

 

The following email template is then sent to the selected people.

From: [Selected Address]
Subject: [Person's Name], your invitation has arrived

Included in the email is your logo (if set), your trip banner image, the trip name, the person's name, the message you edited above and instructions to click through to 'Learn More & Respond'. 

Send Message

After selecting the right people, from the list, click the "Send Message" button to send a new message.

You'll be prompted to:

  1. Review the people, cancel if you don't see the right people's names
  2. Choose your sending address (defaults to you or the Trip Owner)
  3. Write your message (there is no default)
  4. Click "Send Now"

 

The following email template is then sent to the selected people:

From: [Selected Address]
Subject: New Message

Included in the email is your logo (if set), your trip banner image, the trip name, the person's name, the message you edited above and instructions to click through to 'View Trip'. 

Example:

name: Automatic Email Reminders & Confirmations
title: Automatic Email Reminders & Confirmations
body:
All Trips are able to send Automated Reminders & Confirmations, aka Messages, via email, to Registered People. These can be reminders or confirmations as detailed below.

At this time we only support email messages, SMS integration is available for an integration fee.

 

NOTE: Anytime you want to see if an automatic message was sent, check your Trip Activity Feed. This will alert you to the email that was sent, showing who it was sent to, the subject matter, and the click-through button (Call to Action). 

 

You can also send Manual Messages which you can send throughout the Planner View as needed. We recommend you do this as well and not rely 100% on automated messages to improve the customer experience..

All of these messages are branded with your Logo and with your Trip Banner Image and include the Magic Link for the Traveler to see their personalized Trip Page.

We offer customization of these templates for Enterprise clients as an add-on, all other subscriptions should find the automatic branding is sufficient.

 

 

Automated Message: Reminders

Reminders are sent by our automated system on a regular schedule based on the dates you provide on a Trip. You'll know if Auto Reminders are currently enabled by checking under the Update Trip section where the Trip Dates are set.

When no specific dates are set, Reminders are OFF, as shown:

When specific dates are entered, Reminders will be turned ON after saving, as shown:

When specific dates are set, Reminders are ON, as shown:

 

Who gets reminders? (Qualification)

On Trips with Auto Reminders ON, only the Registered People that qualify will receive reminders. They must:

  1. Status = "REGISTERED" - as shown by the green person icon in the Manage People section
  2. Have not received another message from YouLi in the last 24 hours - as shown by the Email Sent column in the Manage People section
  3. Have not completed the payment or task - as shown in the relevant sections

When do they get reminders? (Frequency)

Reminders are sent based on the Timezone of the Trip and the due date of the Task or Payment.

  • 1 week prior to the due date
  • on the due date 
  • 2 days after the due date

 

What kind of reminders do they get?

1. Payment Reminders

NOTE: Trips with Estimated Prices will not send Payment Reminders

Reminders are only enabled if Instalment Due Dates are added. If no dates are set, then NO reminders are sent. Due Date is optional for the Remaining Balance Due, but recommended to enabled Payment Reminders.

Payment reminders take priority over Task Reminders mentioned below. So if there is a Payment and a Task due on the same day, only the Payment reminder will be sent.

See the Automatic Emails sent on your behalf through YouLi for Payments, explore our Help Doc on Automatic Emails for Payments. 

Be sure you turn on automatic payment reminders per installment by clicking the checkbox in the installment popup.  

 

2. Task Reminders

NOTE: Task Reminders are sent if trip dates are set and a due date is set for the task, even with Estimated Prices

Task Reminders are sent to your travelers:

  • 1 week before the due date
  • on the due date
  • two days after the due date 

See examples of automatic emails sent on your behalf through YouLi in our Help Doc on Automatic Emails for Tasks

 

Automated Message: Confirmations

Who gets Confirmations? (Qualification)

When Travelers Register or submit a deposit for your trip, they will get an email confirmation. All Registered Traveler will appear with an indication of their payment status and details on payments they have made in your Manage Payments Tab. Note that if someone registers, pays and then declines, they will still appear here so you can review their payments.

When do they get confirmation? (Frequency)

Confirmations are sent when travelers finish or complete a needed item. 

  • When they register for your trip.
  • When they make a payment.

 

What kind of confirmation do they get? 

1. Registration and Invitation Confirmations

A message is emailed after registration and shown on the Trip Page until Payment is made. You can change the default message by going to Update Trip > Settings. 

 

This will be sent to travelers who register, whether they do so from a public trip or based on receiving an invitation email and clicking the call to action button in the footer. 

 

2. Payment Confirmations

A message is emailed after payment is made to confirm and thank your traveler for paying. See what these payment confirmations look like in our Automatic Emails for Payments Help Doc. 

NOTE: Your travelers will receive a payment notification when they make a payment via their email, however, you also have the option to send a Tax Invoice. 

 

For a visual walk-through, watch our help-video below:  

 

Also, discover How To Stop Automatic Emails. 

 

How do Email Templates work?

To save you from having to create your own emails, YouLi has created a standard set of messages in the form of templates. YouLi automatically replaces things like [Trip Name] or [Traveler Name] with the correct information for your Trip and your Travelers. 

Everything becomes personalized for your Travelers automatically. When looking at the samples in this document, anything that is personal information or trip specific will be replaced. We recommend adding yourself to the trip and go through all the cases to see what your messages will look like.

How many reminders are sent?

We only send one email reminder per 24 hour period. If a Planner has sent a manual message from YouLi on the same day, the reminder will not be sent. Learn more about how to reduce reminder fatigue.

For each task or payment instalment due up to 3 reminders are sent as documented below.

You can view each of the reminders in the Activity Log on Planner view of the Trip. 

Confirmation emails are sent after the relevant action has been taken, this is also logged in the Activity Log.

Who does it come from?

All emails sent from YouLi are sent using our ESP (Email Service Provider). That means it is free for our clients. We ensure they are sent in a way that avoids getting put in the spam folder, but remember that no system is perfect, so be sure to check if NOT RECEIVED.

The FROM address shows as the NAME of the Main Contact, but with the email address of "reply@youli.io". This is for deliverability reasons (to keep the email out of the spam folder). 

The REPLY-TO address is the EMAIL of the Main Contact, so most of the time when a traveler replies to emails sent from YouLi it will go to the Main Contact. 

Sometimes, there is an issue with the way the email is handled and the reply goes back to "reply@youli.io". In this case, an automated message will instruct your traveler to respond via the Trip Page. This is not common, but you can learn more about this case if you hear complaints.

What happens if they click "make an account"?

Travelers who click from the emails to "make an account" will be prompted to make a YouLi Traveler Account. This is totally optional.  Learn more about the YouLi Traveler Account.

name: Magic Link
title: Magic Link
body:
On a Trip, every person that has a name under the Manage People section is assigned a Magic Link. This is a personalized and Branded link that looks like this:

https://youli.io/t/adventure/climb-baby-climb/a55811d3-6995-4050-8a8a-1a8750683450

Why is this important?

Because you can invite people without requiring a password and without requiring an email. 🤩

How do I use the Magic Link?

Click the magic wand for the  and copy the link into any chat window or other communication channel.

 

Watch this YouLi How-To for a more detailed walk through on how to share your trip page without a password (use a magic link) :

name: What is a Co-Planner?
title: What is a Co-Planner?
body:
Ready to add one, but not sure how? See this related help article: How do I add a Co-Planner?

 

Many planners can coordinate on a trip at the same time as Co-Planners, but only one of them can be the Trip Owner.

All Team Members are Co-Planners on team trips, but Co-Planners can be added to individual trips as well. That said, not all Co-Planners are Team Members.

What is the difference in access & functionality between Co-Planners who are added to a trip because they are a part of your team vs. a Co-Planner who is added to an individual trip?

Co-Planners added to individual trips: 

CANNOT edit the information of the cost for your trips. They cannot edit anything under the "pricing" tab, including adding & editing packages. 

Here is the view a Co-Planner will have (note there is no Costs Tab under Update Trip): 

CANNOT be sent test emails from the planner

CANNOT push to Xero

CAN still see traveler payment information

CAN be listed as a contact

CAN be available as an option for sending email from the Planner view

Co-Planners that are added when a trip is created are shown in the Activity Log at the very bottom. All members of a team are automatically added to trips created by any other team member.

 

When a trip is copied, Co-Planners are also copied. So double check your Activity Log after creating your trip to be sure you've got the right Co-Planners.

 

By default only the Owner's contact information is displayed as the Contact on the Trip Page.

 

If you need to change ownership or add a Co-Planner as a Contact, ask the Owner to open a support ticket and include the link to the trip and the email address of the relevant Co-Planner.

name: Trip Owner | Team Owner
title: Trip Owner | Team Owner
body:
Many Planners can coordinate on a Trip at the same time as Co-Planners, but only one of them can be the Trip Owner.  

 

For Planners that have Teams, the Trip Owner is always the Team Owner.

Your Team Owner is the Trip Owner for all Trips you create.

The Trip Owner is also the Main Contact by default. Unless your Team Owner has set you to be a Main Contact on trips you create.

Main Contact can also be changed for each Trip. If this happens a lot, ask your Team Owner to change your Main Contact Trip Setting, so you are the Main Contact on trips you create.

So why does the Trip Owner matter?

The Owner of a Trip determines the Branding on TripPages

1. The Account Alias used in the Share Trip Link and Magic Links

2. TripPage Logo and Colors

name: Account | Site Settings | Team Alias
title: Account | Site Settings | Team Alias
body:
The "team alias" can be found under ACCOUNT > SITE SETTINGS and is used in all of the branded links you and your team share from your account. By default, this value is set based on the Team Owner's name on signup.

You probably want to change this to match your business name.

It is used in share trip links & magic links, so it cannot contain spaces or special characters.

TIP: Check for a trailing space that will lead to a trailing dash (-) before you launch your trips

WARNING:
If you have already:

  1. Sent messages/invites from your trip
  2. Shared magic links
  3. OR posted the public share trip link

then, changing this will BREAK those links.

This means if you have live clients DO NOT change your trip alias, speak to us first.

If you are just starting live, then can change your trip alias on your own & let us know if we need to redirect existing share trip links for you. To let us know, please open a support ticket to request we redirect to the new team alias.

If you do not have any live trips yet, adjust your trip alias with no repercussions.

Note: If you are a Team Member, then you don't own trips by default. They are owned by your Team Owner. Therefore, the share trip links for the trips you work on use the team alias of your Team Owner/Trip Owner.

To access your team alias, go to your ACCOUNT and then click into SITE SETTINGS: 

There are two kinds of links (URLs) this applies to:

1. Share Trip Link

For example, if your Account Alias is mystic-adventures, then your share trip link for the "June 2022 Petra" trip is: 

https://youli.io/t/mystic-adventures/june-2022-petra

Note: You can change the Trip Short Name when you "Update Trip" under the pencil icon inside your trip.

2. Your Plug N Play Website

All premium YouLi accounts include their own Plug N Play Website, should you choose to use it! Only the public and listed trips on your account, appear on your Plug N Play Website.

Again, if your team alias is mystic-adventures, then your Plug N Play Website link preview (you can add your own domain later) would be:

https://web.youli.io/u/mystic-adventures

NOTE: You can also embed your trips on your own website.

name: VIDEO: YouTube Channel & Playlists
title: VIDEO: YouTube Channel & Playlists
body:
Much of our documentation is in video form at our YouTube channel. 

If you don't find what you need, come back and open a ticket asking for help, we love to make your trips happen!

And if you SUBSCRIBE to our YOUTUBE channel you'll be notified as we add new content. We make new videos every time we update the software and send out release notes.

We have a number of Playlists to help you find what you need

  1. Welcome Series - Covering all the topics from our CHECKLISTs in video form
  2. HOW-TO - short but detailed explainers on the many little features you might need
  3. Traveler Videos - in case your travelers need a bit of guidance
  4. Community Meetups - we meet monthly to talk about what matters to you, watch some of them and join the next one
  5. Tasks & Registration Forms
  6. Bookings & People
  7. Users & Roles

name: CHECKLIST: Reviewing your Trip
title: CHECKLIST: Reviewing your Trip
body:
You've created your trip and you think it's ready to go, this checklist will help you make sure you haven't missed anything before you share it with your audience.

Are you new? Have you created a Trip yet?

If you haven't created a trip yet, follow our quick and easy guide to create your first trip. Otherwise, continue reading!

 

Step 1. Review the Trip Settings

In this step, you will be confirming your trip dates, trip privacy, trip description, trip costs & the other big overarching details of your trip.

Click on Update Trip in the Navigation Menu on your left-hand side, From here you will be able to edit the overview, costs, & settings of your trip even while it is live. 

Under the Overview Tab review the overarching details of your Trip : 

  1. Trip Privacy - If you had this private while creating, now might be the time to make it public and listed.
  2. Trip Dates - Double check your dates are correct. You can have estimated "Brochure" dates or "Set Departure" dates. Having Set Departure dates means a date bar will appear on the Trip Page™️ for Travelers.
  3. Close Registrations Date -  You have the option to set a date when Travelers are no longer able to register.
  • Make sure this is in line with the trip dates.
  • The close date will automatically appear in the text, so be sure not to repeat it.
  • We recommend linking to your Trip Shop on YouLi or your website.
  • Trip Description - Clean it up and remember that less is more. Did you add a video?
  • Trip Banner - ensure your trip stands out when shared with the best quality banner image.

    •  

    Under the Costs Tab review your Pricing :

    1. Finalize Your Price if you are ready to collect payments. It is here that you will be able to create instalment pricing for your travelers, activate discounts by setting an individual price and describe all that is included in the Trip Cost. 
    • Check out the YouLi-HowTo videos for a more detailed walkthrough of...
      • The Cost Explanation and Cost Menu on the YouLi Experience
      • How to Set an Individual Price for each Person
      • How to Change Instalment Percentages to a Fixed Payment

     

    Under the Settings Tab review your Trip Page™ Language : 

    1. Settings -  this important tab has all the default text that you can change to make the Trip Page™️ feel like YOUR page. 
    2. Registration Prompts - Personalize your registration prompts. In this section also personalize the 'call to action' button where people will click to register for your trip. 
    3. Menu Labels - These are the labels that your travelers will see on the left side of your trip and will help them navigate all of the information. For more information on how to customize your TripPage™️ Menu & control what your travelers see explore this detailed How-To Customize your TripPage™️ Menu which goes into detail on each section of the page. 
    4. Default Emails - It is here that you can personalize the emails that will go out when you invite travelers, when they register, and if they decline. 

     

    TIP: Did you know? You can share the public trip to just yourself on Facebook to see how it would look to Travelers before sharing publicly. Look for the "Share with myself" option when posting. 

     

    Step 2. Review the Highlights & Itinerary

    While reviewing your Highlights & Itinerary, you will be able to emphasize your cause, a partner, a guide profile and confirm your detailed summary and details of the trip for your travelers. 

     

    1. Highlight Items - Shown on the first section of the Trip Page™️, these always appear with large images. These are key reasons people will want to join your trip. The big 'Highlights'. They can also be shown on the Itinerary section.
    2. Itinerary Items - In this section, you can create day by day summaries, or detailed hour by hour activities. These appear with a small image and all text shown at once. You can feature these in the Highlight section too.
    3. Images - How do they look when you select show all on the Highlights page? Tinker with image sizes to work on any issues. All images are adjusted to fit on mobile automatically. 👍
    4. Optional Items - Highlight and Itinerary Items can be optional. Travelers will be able to choose to attend these items or opt-out. Use this for add-ons or optional dinners.

    Use the Preview function to ensure your Highlights and Itinerary show how you want them to for your traveler. 

     

    Step 3. Finalize Price and Payments

    While reviewing Price & Payments, you will be double-checking cost, cost description, instalments, and payment methods. 

    • If you're using YouLi to collect payments: Finalize the total cost of the trip.  Double-check the numbers.
    • Be sure to update the cost Explanation to mention any optional or additional costs which may not be included in the total cost and to reference your cancellation policy.
    • Instalments - If you would like to get a deposit from your Travelers you can add an instalment. You can set the deposit as a percentage of the total cost or a set amount.

     

    Step 4. Tasks and Resources

    Tasks & Resources is where you will be able to manage all documentation and things you need your travelers to do before the trip. 

     

    Have you included all the required tasks? Check to be sure you didn't make them as itinerary items or put them inside descriptions on accident.

    • ✅ If you want it DONE, make it a TASK: anything the Traveler is required to provide or complete can be a task.
    • Reminders - With YouLi you can set reminders for tasks. No one wants to complete a long registration form and no one reads the FAQ - but YouLi's automated reminders ensure they get their Tasks done. 👍
    • Click through to complete tasks as a Traveler to ensure the completion method is correct. 
      • You can always add a person to the trip for testing and then delete them. 

    Double-check any attached resources aren’t out of place or missing context.

     

    Step 5. Ready to Publish your Trip

    Let's roll it out! Time to make it live!

    Preview the trip as a Traveler once more to catch any final details.

    Remember that a TripPage™️ changes depending on the status of the person viewing it. Try out the important ones so you have confidence you've created the right experience:

    • Public Trip - open a new "Private" or "Incognito" window and paste in the Share Trip Link to see what an anonymous person would see
    • Invited - Add a person under "Manage People" with Going? = "Not Responded", then  VIEW AS to respond as see how the registration process looks
    • Registered - Once you've registered you'll be prompted to pay if the price is finalized, use Direct Payments to test out a "fake payment" and see how the emails look
    • Paid - Once you've paid the People section will appear so they can see who else is going.

     

    You’re now ready to roll your trip out.

    Want more details on publishing your trip? Follow our Publishing a Trip Checklist here!

     

    Video Appendix :

name: Let your Travelers Register, pay and manage for their spouse, friend or team
title: Let your Travelers Register, pay and manage for their spouse, friend or team
body: If you want your customers to book and pay for someone else at the same time, you can take advantage of the Extra Registrations feature on the Trip Settings page.

name: CHECKLIST: Publishing your Trip
title: CHECKLIST: Publishing your Trip
body:
Congratulations, you're ready to get people excited about your trip, booked in and prepared for their trip. This checklist provides a few pointers to make this process easier so you can focus on planning the next one!

Step 1. Trip Users

Co-planners make life easier

  • The Settings page allows you to see all the Users which can access the Trip
  • Click on the +Add User icon in the top right.

Users are not always Travelers but could also be:
- These users are here to help you manage the trip:

  • Trip Coordinator: who can view the Trip, Completed Task and Payments
  • Co-Planner: Users who can update the Trip
  • Team Member: Users within your team.

 

Step 2.  Invites and Promotion

Spread the word!

  • You can add Travelers to a Private Trip by clicking on the People icon. In the top right, click ‘+ Add Person’. You can also bulk upload Travelers.
  • Send all Travelers an invite to them from the People screen.
  • Use the link provided by clicking on Share Trip to spread the word about Public trips.
  • For more information check out our Trip Registration article.

Check out this video for heaps of different features!

People and Payment - You can personalise costs on the People page.
Highlights and Itinerary - You can also individually show of Itinerary items from the Highlights and Itinerary page.

 

Step 3. What does a Traveler See

Remember the Preview?

  • Different Travelers can see different things based on your Settings. View a trip as any of your Travelers from the People page.

Customised Trips - Drill into each page as the Traveler to check custom payment schedules or tasks.
View As - Remember if you View As a Traveler, your Preview will remember the last person you Viewed As. To see the same thing prospective registrations will see, open your Journey in an “Incognito” or “Private” browser.

 

Step 4. List to shop

Open your trip for business!

  • You can list your public Trips on the Update Trip page by checking the "Listed" option.
    • If you're trip is in line with YouLi guidelines, it may also be highlighted on our marketplace and social channels.
  • The Shop is a branded portal which lists all of your Public Listed Trips for travelers to browse and register for.

Brochures - Your Shop can be shared with travelers as a menu linking to all your currently available Set Departures or Brochure trips. Making it easy for them to get all the information they need about your Trips.

 

Step 5. Integrate

Spread the good word!

  • Integrating your trips will allow you to reach more potential Travelers.
    • Find out how to integrate your listed trips into your website.

Integrate - From the Share Trip pop up you can copy the Website Snippet to use on your website.
Socials - Share the Public trip link or your Shop link on your social media accounts to spread the word.

name: VIDEO: Welcome Series
title: VIDEO: Welcome Series
body: Not sure where to get started, watch our welcome series:

name: How do I bulk upload people and email addresses?
title: How do I bulk upload people and email addresses?
body:
If you need to invite people to a Trip from a spreadsheet or downloaded from another system, then BULK UPLOAD is the fastest way to do that.

Take Note: Bulk Uploads CANNOT be undone. Be sure to review the preview carefully and your data prior to clicking CONFIRM.

OTHER OPTION: Perhaps you connect a zap? 

*be sure to check the packages available to you by clicking UPGRADE in YouLi. 

How To Bulk Upload from Manage People

1. From your Dashboard, click on any Group Trip

2. Click on 'Manage People'

3. Click on 'Bulk Upload'

4. In the pop-up add your list of invitees by uploading your csv file 

 

Data Formatting Rules: 

You have two options to upload your data:

1. Paste or type into the box provided

2. Upload a file 

 

Either way, the formatting requirement is the same, each row must have 3 comma-separated fields:

First Name,Last Name,Email,Phone

Take Note: Be sure that there are no spaces before or after the commas. If there are spaces, the upload will NOT go through. 

 

First Name and Last Name must NOT be merged

This was changed in release 1.110

VALID: Name as TWO fields:

FirstName,LastName,Email,Phone

INVALID: Name as one field: (DO NOT UPLOAD THIS FORMAT)

Full Name,Email,Phone

Email is required

Email address is the only required field, but all three fields must exist, see last row in the sample.

Email MUST be UNIQUE

There can be no duplicate emails in your list.

WARNING: Email is used as a key to do updates, so if the email is in the file twice, the upload will fail.

TIP: If you use a ESP like MailChimp or Campaign Monitor, you can load a list there and then it will de-duplicate for you and you can download from there to load into YouLi

No header row needed

Do not include a header row, it will cause the entire upload to fail.

If your other system has added it automatically, open the file and delete it before uploading into YouLi.

 

Sample File

In this same file we have

  1. Row with First and Last name, email, but no phone number
  2. Row with First and Last name, email, and phone number including country code
  3. Row with First and Last name, email, and phone number
  4. Row with First name only, email, and no phone number
  5. Row with no name, email, and no phone number
Cat,Wynne,caitlin@youli.io,
Jen,Fein,jen@youli.io,+18583148840
Smita,Kulkarni,smita@youli.io,0423839021
Jamal,,jamal@youli.io,
,,noname@youli.io,

Updating in Bulk

If you already have people added, you can download them by clicking "Download sample file", then edit them and upload the changes.

TIP: Email address is used as the matching field to apply updates. This is helpful if you need to make changes to names and phone numbers.

NOTE: Changes to email address will result in a NEW invitee being added. You can either delete the other one, or, instead of uploading the new email, change the email address of the existing invitee directly by clicking 'EDIT' from the table.

NOTE: Blank phone numbers and names with matching email addresses will delete the phone number and name for that email. Be careful not to upload blank data if that is not the intended result.

Trip Status & Automated emails

Take Note: When a file of new people is successfully uploaded, NO automatic email is sent because they are in the "INVITED" state. This also means that no payment or task reminders will be sent until they accept from the Trip Page or you change their status from Manage People.

If you want to send an automatic email to all of the people so they can click to register on the trip:

1. Click into 'Manage People'

2. Then, select the new invitees

3. Click 'Send Invite'

If you want to change their status or invitation groups in bulk:

Only people with status of REGISTERED will get automatic reminders for payments and tasks.

You can change them quickly by using Bulk Edit.

Learn More about how Trip Registration works in YouLi.

 

USE ZAPIER INSTEAD: 

Not a fan of manual data manipulation? Make a Zap instead

Use this sample zap to get started:
https://zapier.com/shared/eb833e8e133b1e4e491d165776fcf1ed6f573a89

 

TROUBLESHOOTING: 

Seeing an error on preview screen? 

If you're not able to upload because of an unknown error, check your email addresses and make sure they do not have spaces or other invalid data.

Email addresses should be like: name@domain.tld 

Where name is unique, domain does not contain special characters and includes a TLD (Top Level Domain) like ".com" or ".co.uk" or ".travel"

Invalid addresses look like:

  • na me@domain.tld
  • name@ domain.tld
  • name!domain.tld
  • -name@domain.tld
  • name@do!main.tld

Can't see the bulk upload button? 

If the bulk upload button is missing, try on a larger screen.

Why is my excel not uploading? 

Make sure you are following the data formatting rules. You need to have an email & if you do not have name or phone number, make sure there is still a comma included in place of the blank space on your csv. 

 

Tip: If you have a super long list of uploads, it can be easier to break it into just 50 invitees per csv uploads. This can be an easier way to ensure you are following the formatting rules. 

 

Need to merge or combine two YouLi trips together? 

Right now, the best way to combine two trips on YouLi is to download one trip's registered travelers and the bulk upload those into the trip you want to keep.

name: How do I integrate with my website?
title: How do I integrate with my website?
body:
For premium YouLi plans, public trips are available to integrate into any website for SEO and marketing purposes. Watch the workshop below to learn how you can integrate group itineraries into your website, blog, or an affiliate travel marketplace. 

Why integrate itineraries with your website? 

  • No need to duplicate information on your website - simply embed your YouLi Trips so travelers can find your itineraries and book easily
  • Embedded trips automatically disappear after their start date passes (except when embedded as individual trips) so you don't have to remember to remove them from your website
  • No need to do custom development on your site, to show complex itineraries
  • Increased conversions - with trip embeds, visitors never leave your site to complete the booking, so there are higher chances of completing the sale or an application process. 

How do trip embeds work? 

This is done using a Javascript website snippet to embed a preview of your trip in the form of "Trip Cards" on your own website.

Here's an example from Melanated.travel - see it live on her Plug N Play website.

Which of these 4 circumstances applies to you?

Don't already have a website?

Did you know your YouLi plan comes with a Plug N Play website?

 

Are you an Affiliate selling someone else's trips?

This documentation applies to you, but with the added bonus that when you embed on your website, YOU get credit for any bookings you deliver to the operator who has invited you to sell their trips.

YouLi will automatically add your affiliate tracking code to the links on the embedded Trip Cards.

Learn more about being an affiliate on YouLi.

 

Just want to link from a Landing Page

If you just have a button on your landing page or website and you just want to link that page to the registration form on YouLi, watch this quick video.

 


Already have a website? Use the Website Snippet to Embed

Unlike other booking platforms, we understand that you probably invested a lot in your existing website, so we make it easy to embed your trips on your existing website.

The embed works well on WordPress and websites that do not restrict the use of <script> tags. No need for a Wordpress plugin.

You can integrate at any time, even before your trips are created or finalized.

Note: Do you use Wix? Use this trick, add a <p> tag if you're seeing a blank space, like this:

<p></p><script src="https://youli.io/embeds/script/trips/mystic-adventures/?view=card&style=detailed"></script>

 

It is best to integrate while your website is under development to ensure your trips fit seamlessly into your site design. You might even find you have to build fewer pages because YouLi provides what you need out of the box to showcase your itineraries. 

White-label Domain: To make the integration even smoother, you can choose to purchase a white-label domain so that your YouLi Trips are hosted on a subdomain of your website domain. If you're interested in this add-on, simply request a demo and our team can tell you if it's right for you.


There are two ways you can embed your trips into your own website: 

1. Embed each individually into your own website. When embedding a single trip, it will remain on your website until you remove it or set it to private, even after the trip date is past. These Trip Cards take up as much space as you give them on your page (fit in a small space or fill the whole width).

EXAMPLE:

2. Embed ALL LISTED TRIPS into your own website. Then each time you create a trip (and make it Public & Listed) it will show up where ever you embedded the code in your own website. Trips automatically disappear from your website when the trip start date has passed.

EXAMPLE:

CLICK HERE for instructions to embed a SINGLE YouLi Trip into your own website

CLICK HERE for instructions to embed ALL YouLi trips into your own website

Advanced

Have you done your embed and now you're ready to move to the next level? 

  1. First setup your tags on all your Public + Listed trips - Learn How
  2. Work with your website developer to create drop downs to filter your trips based on your tags - Learn How
    • See example here: https://runwildretreats.com/about-the-run-wild-retreat-experience/levels/
  3. Want a different look to the embedded cards? Share these instructions with your website developer to customize - Learn How

name: How do I bulk edit multiple People? (Edit Selected)
title: How do I bulk edit multiple People? (Edit Selected)
body:
YouLi makes it easy for you to edit multiple travelers at one time. You can adjust Registration Status, Invitation Group, Cost, and more. 

 

How to Bulk Edit Travelers

Click into the desired trip from the Dashboard and then click MANAGE PEOPLE from the left navigation. Select the people you'd like to change from the list. If there are no people, you can bulk upload them. 

Click 'Edit Selected' 

A popup will appear that allows you to select the fields you want to change. After selecting your travelers, YouLi will let you know how many you selected. For example: "5 invitees will be updated"  

Pro Tip: You can see who you selected by clicking the down arrow next to the phrase

 

Note: Only the shown fields can be changed at the same time. Any other profile field can only be edited by clicking 'CANCEL' then clicking 'EDIT' under the name of the individual.

 

 

You can always check the Activity Feed to see the change confirmation or check the individual people in the list.

name: How do I comply with GDPR data removal request?
title: How do I comply with GDPR data removal request?
body:
Background: The GDPR introduces a right for individuals to have personal data erased. The right to erasure is also known as 'the right to be forgotten'. Individuals can make a request for erasure verbally or in writing.

After or during the planning of a successful trip on YouLi, you might run into this situation:

You receive a request from a European citizen to erase their data or delete their personal information; not to worry!

If they have not made a payment on the trip, you can delete them yourself via the Manage People link inside the trip. 

However, for auditing reasons it is not possible to delete them if they have made a payment. In this case, simply open a support request with the traveler and trip details, including the following:

1) only one trip?

2) delete all data and files, including reference to any payment gateway ids? Note that we cannot purge data from the payment gateway or your bank. Please check with your other providers if that is necessary.

3) traveler name and email

4) trip name

YouLi does not purge data without your request until 5 years after creation. If you need a whole trip removed, simply Archive it and then open a request to delete it PERMANENTLY. The owner of the trip must make the request and include a reason. 

Enterprise clients can request an automated removal in compliance with their data retention policy.

name: HOW-TO: Customize Trip Page Menu - Control What Your Travelers See
title: HOW-TO: Customize Trip Page Menu - Control What Your Travelers See
body:
TRIP PAGE MENU

On the Trip Page, your travelers will see menu labels for the various sections of the page: 

  1. Highlights
  2. Itinerary
  3. People
  4. Invoice
  5. Tasks
  6. Documents
  7. Contact 

EDIT & HIDE MENU ITEMS

  • UPDATE TRIP > SETTINGS
  • Scroll down to find the "TRIP PAGE MENU LABELS"

The defaults should work for most people, but you can customize them to use the language that makes sense for your travelers.

You have the option to hide menu items by unchecking the box next to the item you would like to hide. You can not hide Highlights

 

  1. The Highlights (Program/The Plan) section 
    • ALWAYS appears
    • Includes the Trip Description & all items marked as a "Highlight", including any Itinerary items that have the "Also show on Highlights" option checked.

  2. Itinerary (Details) section
    • This is a helpful section for Printing since it is text-based instead of image-based.
    • Even if it IS visible, the menu will NOT be shown if there are NO Itinerary items.
  3. The People section NOTE: Only registered travelers will ever see this section
    • Even if it IS visible, the menu will NOT be shown if
      • There are no people "Going" on the trip
      • The person viewing the trip is not registered as "Going"
      • It is a Public trip and the person viewing the page has not yet paid
    • If it is hidden by a Planner, the menu will STILL be shown to people in Invitation Groups so they can view the people in their group and manage their profiles and tasks. The rest of the travelers will NOT be shown to them.

  4. The Invoice (previously Costs) section WARNING: Travelers cannot pay and book if this is hidden
    1. Even if it IS visible, the menu will NOT be shown if:
      • Price is ESTIMATED (not finalized) AND
      • No Pricing Explanation is set under Update Trip->Pricing->Pricing Explanation
  5. The Tasks section 
    1. Travelers cannot complete tasks if this is hidden
    2. This menu will NOT be shown if:
      • The Trip is Public and the viewer has not yet registered
      • The Traveler viewing does not have any assigned Tasks

  6. Documents (Resources) section
    1. This menu will NOT be shown if:
      • The Trip is Public and the viewer has not yet registered
      • There are no Trip Resources attached to tasks by the Planners
      • The Traveler viewing does not have any assigned Tasks with resources

  7. The Contact section
    1. This menu will NOT be shown if:
      1. There are no Planners "Listed As Contact" under Settings->Trip Users

name: What to do if your Invitee is still showing as NOT VIEWED?
title: What to do if your Invitee is still showing as NOT VIEWED?
body:
If an Invited Person has not viewed your invitation, this could be for a few reasons:

 

1) The email hasn’t been sent

Check the last email date to see if it says "NOT SENT" like Kevin in the screenshot below. If there is a date like for Darcie, check how long ago it was and try sending the invite again.

 

2) The email went to spam!

I know, this sucks, but it happens on any automated system.

It can help to send a message out to your people from your personal account letting them know to look for and "whitelist" the from address. You can share this link to explain how to do this for different computers: https://www.campaignmonitor.com/resources/guides/whitelisting/

Once people find and whitelist the email the first time, it is likely to be delivered to the inbox for them and others.

We have options for customizing the email sending domain for premium subscriptions, but this is typically not necessary for emails to be delivered to the inbox.

For first time invitations, we recommend grabbing the magic link (click the magic wand next to their name) and emailing it directly or sending via your fav messenger app. Watch the video to see how easy it is!

If you have too many people to do this by hand, make your trip Public (not Listed) and share the link to your group through other channels. They can then register on the Public Travel Page without you having to inviting them manually. You can then change the trip back to Private when everyone is registered.

 

3) The person doesn’t want to respond via email/web.

Some people are still old fashioned. You can give them a call if you have their number and then record their response in YouLi so you have it in one place

Remember you can always hover over their name and click VIEW AS to respond to all tasks and optional items as the invited person.

name: HOW-TO: Add a Co-Planner or Team Member to a Trip
title: HOW-TO: Add a Co-Planner or Team Member to a Trip
body:
With the right YouLi plan, you can add Team Members to help you co-plan your trips. 

If you're inviting someone to help you manage your trips, first, ask yourself some key questions:

1. ARE THEY PART OF YOUR TEAM?

If they should have access to ALL the same trips as the Team Owner, then the Team Owner should go to their ACCOUNT and select the TEAM MEMBERS tab. From there, they can add a new Team Member.

The new Team Member will be

  1. Notified via email that they have been added
  2. Instructed to reset their password to log in

Actions

  • Click the airplane to resend an email if they have NOT ACCEPTED or need to reset their password.
  • Click the trash to remove them from the Team, NOTE: this does not delete them and they can be added by later if they remain an EXPLORER.
  • Click the pencil to edit their information.

Main Contact

If your Team Member is the main contact or primary contact on the trips and that should be visible to Travelers, then you should make them a Main Contact for all trips they create. In that case, select YES for this option.

Listed As Contact on Trip Page by Default

When "No" has been selected for MAIN CONTACT, then you have the option to decide whether this Team Member will be Listed as Contact by default on Trip Pages made by the Team.

There are three options:

To determine which is the right option, ask yourself:

Should the Team Member's contact information appear on the Trip Pages for Travelers to contact BY DEFAULT?

NOTE: you can always change this once a trip has been created, so this feature is just to ensure that if a particular team member is ALWAYS a contact on trips, then you don't have to manually add that on the trip each time.

  • If not, chose NO.
  • If Yes, then chose when this should be true:
    • For all existing trips AS WELL AS new trips to be created
    • For only new trips made from this point forward

These settings apply to all trips created within the Team.

If you chose YES, then your new Team Member will appear like this on the Trip Pages of the Trips they are co-planning.

Once logged in the new Team Member will see all Trips owned by the Team Owner and be automatically added to all future trips created by any Team Member shown in the table.

NOTE: Not all subscriptions include Team Members, you may be prompted to upgrade. If you have any questions, you can always Book a Demo with our team to explain the options.

2. Are they helping just with one Trip?

If the person should have access to only one or a few of your Trips, then you might want to invite them as a one-off Co-Planner or Trip Coordinator.

Click on the "Manage Planners" inside the trip to see your Trip Users.

You can add unlimited Co-Planners and Trip Coordinators to help you with your trip.

 

Troubleshooting

If you try to add someone as a TEAM MEMBER but they are already on another team, you’ll see this error:

Then you are trying to add someone who is part of another organization as a team member, but you probably just want to add them to a few trips as a co-planner. So, simply click into the specific trip, click Manage Settings on the left navigation,  and add that person via the Trip Users +Add User button.

 

For a walkthrough on YouLi, watch our YouLi How-To video on adding a Trip Page™️ Contact:

name: Delete a person from a trip
title: Delete a person from a trip
body: If you need to remove a person that has registered on a trip or that you invited, you can Delete them if they do not have an associated payment record.

name: How do I download All Documents from a Task?
title: How do I download All Documents from a Task?
body:
It's easy, just click on the cloud with a down arrow next to "Documents Uploaded"

To view the Task Responses, click on RESPONSES under the Task you need.
